title: Uh lu'umil Zazil-ha Blue Carbon Mangrove Conservation Project, Conserving Coastal Ecosystems in Quintana Roo to Support Life
description:
In Mexico, the mangrove areas in the state of Quintana Roo are significantly impacted by deforestation. Among the major drivers of the forestation in the region it is possible to identify: storm damage, invasive plants (Casuarina) and real estate development.

According to a previous study made for the project proponent, the deforestation rate in the state of Quintana Roo was 0.25% for the period of 2005-2015. For the Cozumel region specifically, the deforestation rate was 2.74%/year for the same period.

The Project activity is a REDD+ grouped project that intents to address the unplanned deforestation of state-owned, private and ejidos’ mangroves areas in the state of Quintana Roo. Currently, there are 4 project activity instances in this grouped project: 1 in Cozumel and 3 in Othon P. Blanco. In the future, more project activity instances will be added to this grouped project. 

Conservation activities include reestablishing canals, maintaining canal structures, soil rehabilitation, deforestation monitoring, and monitoring of biodiversity.
The project proponent has been engaging with communities in ejidos and private lands since 2016 under a participatory and inclusive approach and will also include more properties as the project is developed. BlueMX will also promote training meetings and materials to empower communities to carry out the conservation activities.

Currently, the grouped project totals 4,860 hectares of wetlands and is estimated to reduce approximately 11,610 t CO2e per year.

title: Feijó REDD+ Project
description:
The primary objective of the Feijó REDD+ Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD) of the 27,248.86 ha project area, and to avoid planned deforestation (APD) of the 5,094.85 ha project area within two private properties in the municipality of Feijó, State of Acre, consisting of 100% Amazon rainforest. 

Beyond the project’s ecological and carbon benefits, a proportion of the carbon credits generated will be dedicated to improving the social and environmental conditions in the project region, specifically contributing to improving deforestation control, and developing environmental education and other social activities. The contribution to sustainability is being monitored through the application of the SOCIALCARBON® Standard. 

The AUD REDD project is expected to avoid a predicted 15,697.94 ha of deforestation, equating to 6,295,553 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime (02-January-2019 to 01-January-2049), with an annual average of 209,852 tCO2e. 
The APD REDD project is expected to avoid a predicted 1,751 ha of deforestation, equating to 7,153,896 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime (02-January-2019 to 01-January-2049), with an annual average of 238,463 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents

title: Grouped rooftop solar power project by SAEL Limited
description:
The project involves installation of Solar Photovoltaic (SPV) Panels on rooftops of educational institutions in various states of India by SAEL Limited (Previously, Sukhbir Agro Energy Ltd). All the rooftop solar panel units involved in the project are implemented under RESCO model where SAEL acts as a RESCO (Renewable Energy Service Company). Being the RESCO, SAEL has developed, installed, financed, operates and owns the rooftop solar power units and supplies power generated from the project to the consumers on whose premises the rooftop SPV panels are set up. The building owners are the customers of the power generated from the rooftop solar panels who purchase the power from SAEL Limited under long term power purchase agreements signed for 25 years.

The purchased power by the customers is either consumed/utilized by the customers for in the buildings premises or injected to the grid of the Distribution Utility under the mechanism of net metering.

Under the concept of Net Metering, the customers are charged only for the net power that they consume from the electricity service provider that has accumulated over a specific period. In other words, if their renewable energy generating systems make more electricity than consumed, they may be credited or paid for the excess electricity contributed to the grid over the same period. Net metering is also a way to increase the energy in the power grid to keep up with increase in demand during peak power use times, and this is of particular interest to states facing power shortages.
VCS Proponent:
SAEL Limited
Uttar Pradesh, India

title: Jiangxi Tonggu Improved Forest Management Project
description:
The Jiangxi Tonggu Improved Forest Management Project (hereafter referred to as “the project”) is located in Tonggu County, Yichun City, Jiangxi Province, P.R.China. It is implemented by Jiangxi Huapeng Industrial Co., Ltd (hereafter “Project Proponent”) to protect the once logging forest. 

The proposed project is implemented in Chashan Forestry Centers, Daduan Town, Gangkou Township, Gaoqiao Township, Paibu Town, Qiping Town, Sandu Town, and Wenquan Town. The project has 5719.06ha commercial forest, whose ages ranging from sapling, middle age to mature forest. Prior to the implementation of the project, Forests in the project area were harvested following the guidelines in Timber Harvest Plan approved by the local forestry bureau. In order to protect the forest ecosystem, improve the ecological environment, increase carbon sinks, reduce GHG emission reductions and slow down climate change, the project proponent decided to implement this improved forest management project activities from November 2017 to October 2047. And from the Project Start Date, PP has stopped the commercial logging in the project area.

The project activity will significantly improve the forest management conditions within the project area, and benefit local ecological environment. The implementation of the project will not only achieve a reliable measurable carbon sequestration by reducing commercial timber, but also contribute to sustainable development of the local community, host country.

The estimated annual emission reduction of the project is  63,127 tCO2e, and the total estimated emission reductions will reach 1,893,823  tCO2e with 30 years’ crediting period. According to the Non-Permanence Risk Report, with buffering deducting, the estimated annual emission reduction of the project is 51,765 tCO2e, and the total estimated emission reductions will reach 1,552,935 tCO2e during the 30 years’ crediting period.
VCS Proponent:
Jiangxi Huapeng Industrial Co., Ltd
Jiangxi Province, China

The state of Acre is facing a rise in deforestation due to cattle ranching activities, with an 8.3% increase of cattle heads from 2020 to 2021. Bujari also presented an increase of 15.5% from 2018 to 2020 , while Porto Acre the growth was of 23.5% in the same period. The project will promote forest conservation and, consequently, reduce greenhouse gas emission that would occur due to deforestation. A consortium of 4 rural properties comprises the Hiwi REDD+ Project Area.

title: Agroforestry and Reforestation for Carbon Sequestration in Indonesia
description:
Agroforestry and Reforestation for Carbon Sequestration in Indonesia is a grouped afforestation and
reforestation project initiated by PUR Projet in 2021. The purpose of the project is to reforest the
degraded land and to promote sustainable agroforestry with local farmers located in the Indonesian
regions of Sumatra Island, Bangka Belitung Islands, Sulawesi Island, and Java Island.

PUR Projet develops agroforestry projects with local institutions (agricultural
cooperatives & rural communities) and local farmers who want to engage into more virtuous
agricultural practices. Providing technical support, training, and free access to seedlings - PUR
Projet will work with participants to plant trees on their land in the interest of protection and

The main objectives of the project are as follows:

- Implement full stand rehabilitation and restoration of degraded lands.
- Climate change mitigation through carbon removals generated by tree-planting
activities.
- Raise environmental awareness and knowledge within rural communities and
promote sustainable agriculture practices.

title: Andes Inorganic Carbon Capture on Agricultural Soils
description:
Andes has developed a carbon dioxide (CO2) removal solution based on the action of microorganisms interacting with plant roots, which accelerate the formation of minerals (bio-mineralization) in the soil.
The company is planning to first implement this biotechnology on row crops, including corn, soybean, and wheat, in the United States. In parallel, Andes is also planning to deploy its technology in Canada and South America.
Starting acreage for 2022 will be 25,000 acres with a steep growth during the upcoming years. We are planning to extend the program up to 500,000 acres for the 2023 season. The program will continue growing through the following years, reaching over 65 million acres by 2031.
VCS Proponent: N/A
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Patagonia Region Improved Grazing Project
description:
The Patagonia Region Improved Grazing Project aims to remove greenhouse gases from the atmosphere by implementing improved grazing management on multiple farms in Argentina. It is a grouped project.  The initial activity instances comprise 20,123 hectares that will generate on average an estimated 24,952 tCO2e of emissions reductions annually.  It is expected ultimately to comprise >500,000 hectares and generate on average an estimated 620,000 of emissions reductions annually. Improved grazing will increase the rest and rotation on pastures above baseline practices and reduce unrestricted grazing by livestock. Pastures will be grazed with higher livestock densities followed by longer periods of rest, increasing both plant productivity and soil carbon inputs relative to baseline conditions. This results in the sequestration of greenhouse gases from the atmosphere to the soil. 
Land operators are provided funding to increase fencing and water access needed to create more and smaller pastures and to provide the added labor needed to manage more frequent livestock movements. Project participants are required to manage for concentrated animal impact on small pastures with a focus on extended rest periods allowing for regrowth and recovery of leaf tissue, seed establishment, and replenishment of root reserves. In the baseline scenario, the pastures are larger and the livestock movement among pastures is less frequent. This allows grazing animals to select for preferred perennial species, which then become overgrazed and insufficient rest periods favor the encroachment by shrubs, annual grasses, and larger occurrence of bare ground.
The grouped project is on eligible grasslands of Argentina. The project area consists of grassland grazed by livestock on participating farms. Soils throughout the project area are primarily coarse-textured sand to sandy loam and have been losing carbon for over 100 years due to the continuous, selective grazing under the baseline scenario. Consequently, soils in the project area are modelled to have a high potential to store carbon under intensive, high rotation grazing management.

title: Northern Great Plains Regenerative Grazing Project 2
description:
The Northern Great Plains Regenerative Grazing Project 2 aims to remove greenhouse gasses from the atmosphere by implementing sustainable grazing management on multiple ranches in Montana and parts of Wyoming, Idaho, Washington, North Dakota, and South Dakota. It is a grouped project starting with 10,000 hectares that will generate on average an estimated 17,000 tCO2e of emissions reductions annually, and expected to grow to >1MM acres in the first year. Planned grazing will increase the rest and rotation on pastures above baseline practices and reduce unrestricted grazing by livestock. Pastures will be grazed with higher livestock densities followed by longer periods of rest, increasing both plant productivity and soil carbon inputs relative to baseline conditions. This results in the sequestration of greenhouse gasses from the atmosphere to the soil.
Land operators are provided funding to increase fencing and water infrastructure needed to create more and smaller pastures and to provide the added labor needed to manage more frequent livestock movements. Project participants are required to manage for concentrated animal impact on small pastures with a focus on extended rest periods allowing for regrowth and recovery of leaf tissue, seed establishment, and replenishment of root reserves. In the baseline scenario, the pastures are larger and the livestock movement among pastures is less frequent. This allows grazing animals to select for preferred perennial species, which then become overgrazed and insufficient rest periods favor the encroachment by shrubs, annual grasses, and larger occurrence of bare ground.
The grouped project is on eligible grasslands and parts of Wyoming, Idaho, Washington, North Dakota, and South Dakota. The project area consists of grassland grazed by livestock on participating ranches. Soils throughout the project area are predominantly a mix of sandy and silty clay loams and have been losing carbon for over 100 years due to the continuous, selective grazing under the baseline scenario. Consequently, soils in the project area are modeled to have a high potential to store carbon under intensive, high rotation grazing management.

title: REGENERATING DEGRADED LANDS IN FLORIDA THROUGH PONGAMIA
description:
This grouped project aims to reforest and restore degraded agricultural lands by planting Pongamia trees. Reforestation started in 2018, through the planting of 100 to 145 Pongamia  trees per acre (250 to 360 trees per hectare, approximately). The project aims to increase the Pongamia plantation area to 1,000 ha and certify carbon offsets for a period of 20 years following the small-scale afforestation and reforestation methodology (VCS - AR-AMS0007). 
Regenerative agriculture is a system of growing food that reverses climate change by revitalizing natural ecosystems and agricultural lands while improving water quality and soil biodiversity. It improves the health of soils capable of producing high quality, nutrient dense food. Currently, the project areas are in a high state of degradation due to intensive agriculture practices. Although the project represents an intervention on the ground, it favors the increase and recovery of land that enhances the possibility of connecting fragments of forest, reducing fertilization use and providing an additional source of income to the landowners.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: BONOS DE LA RUTA SIAN KA'AN
description:
The Project BONOS DE LA RUTA SIAN KA'AN is situated in the Ejido Caoba (The Ejido) in the southern state of Quintana Roo State, Mexico. Ecology-wise, the Project is in the Central American portion of Mexico, bordering the country of Belize. This zone has an important tropical forest corridor. 
Ejido Caoba contains a significant forestry mass; its production area covers 30,000 ha of medium evergreen tropical forest, low evergreen tropical forest, savannahs, and deciduous tropical forest. From which 7,905 ha are destined for conservation and restricted use. Use of the tropical forest carried out by Ejido members dates back to the 19th century, and it is legally represented in the form of forestry concessions on national land, part of a whole organizational process linked to the sustainable use and management of tropical forestry resources. 
In 2013, Ejido Caoba was the first one in Mexico to obtain the International Certification for Good Practices and Operations in Forest Management and the Chain of Custody (CoC) Certification of Forest Stewardship Council (FSC). Today with the Project BONOS DE LA RUTA SIAN KA'AN, in English Carbon Credits of the Gate of Heaven, The Ejido aims to reach a new pivot point with its forestry management. Ejido Caoba decided to generate carbon credits through the removals of greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) by the VM0003 Methodology for Improved Forest Management through Extension of Rotation Age Version 1.2, Sectoral Scope 14. 
The Project began in October 2017 and will have an expected duration of 30 years; during this period, the removal of 20,835,260 tCO2e is expected through the implementation of activities related to four strategic lines: strengthening of governance, alternative productive projects, recovery and rehabilitation of tropical forest, and above-ground biomass monitoring.
VCS Proponent:
Ban.CO2 de Carbono Mestizo
Ciudad de México, Mexico
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Puwangzi Afforestation Project
description:
Puwangzi Afforestation Project (hereafter refer to as “the project”) is located within Pu’an county, Wangmo county in Qianxinan Buyi and Miao Autonomous Prefecture and Ziyun county in Anshun city, Guizhou Province of China. It is an inland province, bordering Yunnan to the west, Sichuan to the northwest, Hunan to the east and Chongqing to the North. The province has a total population of 34 million. The project aims to plant native species on suitable land for forest  for GHG removal whilst contributing to local sustainable development goals.
25,901 ha (388,515 Mu ) of forest was planted on suitable land for forest in Pu’an county, Wangmo county in and Ziyun county which used to be poor sustainable ecological environment and karst rocky desertification. Prior to the project, the project area was suitable land for forest, there is no forestry management and the coverage by planting trees is low, and there has never been any activity affecting the local ecosystem . By checking the afforestation plan with the forestry bureau of Qianxinan and Anshun, it was confirmed that, a small number of trees have been planted in some project area before the project started, but the coverage by planting trees is low. So considering the low forest coverage, the forestry bureau of Qianxinan and Anshun determined that the project area is suitable for afforestation after investigation, then the local forestry bureau approved the supplementary planting without disturbing the existing trees in January 2019 to increase the vegetative cover.

title: BATMAN LANDFILL GAS (LFG) CAPTURE AND UTILIZATION PROJECT
description: In order to develop a municipal solid waste management system that will be environmentally friendly and sustainable, Batman Landfill Gas (LFG) Capture and Utilization Project is being implemented by Anahtar Enerji Sanayi ve Ticaret Anonim Şirketi. The purpose of the project is to capture and utilize landfill gas for power generation.  The new gas extraction and utilization systems have been installed by the project owner. Before the implementation of the project activity, landfill gas that was captured and utilized by the project was emitted into the atmosphere directly. The project is located in Merkez District in the city of Batman, in southeast of Turkey. The waste deposition at the landfill in Batman is carried out since 2005.  The project activity is a Methane Gas Power Generating Plant with an installed capacity of 3,12 MWe. The project was commissioned  with generation of electricity from October 30th, 2020, which is regarded as the project start date. For the purpose of a sustainable waste management in which domestic wastes will be evaluated, it is planned to rehabilitate the Batman Solid Waste Disposal Site that receives around 127,750 tons/year, corresponding to an average of 350 tons per day of municipal waste coming from districts of Batman province and to generate renewable electricity power from landfill gas and the rehabilitation project was approved by the Ministry of Environment and Urbanization in Turkey. This project adopts a crediting period of 7 years. The expected average annual emission reductions are 59,642 tCO2eq/y. Accordingly, the project is expected to generate 417,494  tCO2eq emissions reduction throughout its first crediting period.

title: Rio Preto Grouped REDD+ Project
description:
The primary objective of the Rio Preto REDD+ Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD) of the 3,096 ha project area, consisting 100% of Amazon rainforest. The project area is located within 2 private properties in Nova Marilândia and Santo Afonso municipalities, in the State of Mato Grosso. This project was designed as a grouped project, in order to be able to increase its contribution to the standing forest with the addition of new project activity instances in the future.

The contribution to sustainability is monitored through the application of the SOCIALCARBON® Standard, which is based on six main indicators: Biodiversity; Natural; Financial; Human; Social and Carbon Resources.

The present REDD project is expected to avoid a predicted 1,287 ha of deforestation, equating to 477,066 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime, with an annual average of 15,902 tCO2e.

title: Maraui Program - Grouped Project
description:
Current research established nine planetary boundaries to define the environmental limits within which humanity can safely operate. Within those, two core boundaries — climate change and biosphere integrity — have been highlighted, each of which has the potential to drive the Earth system into a new state should they be substantially and persistently transgressed (Rockström et al., 2009; Steffen et al., 2015).
Inspired by a call of action, Maraui Program was designed to act upon the two wicked problems — Climate Change & Biodiversity Loss. Maraui Program intends to halt GHG emissions by avoiding ecosystem conversion while protecting Biodiversity. Furthermore, such a program aims to aid in a range of pressing issues, from preserving Freshwater Resources to improving Traditional Communities’ livelihood. 
The Program is a grouped project - as per VCS definition - located in the states of Piauí and Maranhão, Brazil. Owners of rich Biodiversity, Piauí and Maranhão states are home to one of the most intense agricultural frontiers of the country and are the most poverty-stricken states - the lowest average income in Brazil (IBGE, 2021). At the issuance of this document, one Project Activity Instance (PAI) has been instituted, Fazenda Boqueirão (27,458.29 hectares).

title: Sustainable Agricultural Land Management Project by Greneity
description:
This project activity aims at the farmers and the farming communities to enable them adopt improved agricultural practices such as crop residue management for enhancing their crop productivity and sequester CO2 in the soil. The project activity is located in five different states of India – Bihar, Punjab, Maharashtra , Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh. 
The farmers involved in this project activity are small and marginal who are vulnerable from the impacts of climate change. A heavy dependence on chemical synthetic inorganic nitrogen fertilizers, post-harvest crop residue burning and disturbance of soil through intense tilling operations have led to severe degradation of the cropland soils. It has also made the agricultural system not only vulnerable to the impacts of climate change but also a major contributor to greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions can be reduced.

title: Itaúba REDD+ Project
description: The ITAÚBA REDD+ PROJECT aims at protecting forests in one of the regions having the highest deforestation trends in the Amazon Biome, in the municipalities of Itaúba and Marcelândia. Both the municipalities are inside the “Arc of Deforestation” and since the colonization of the municipalities, besides the damage caused to natural ecosystems, several social conflicts have emerged from the dynamics of unsustainable land use, associated with the extensive deforestation and degradation activities. Throughout time, communities with livelihoods based on family-scale agriculture and forest resources were expulsed from the region and gave place to  large scale agricultural and pasture activities.  For the project period, the baseline scenario for the Project Area indicates that the historical patterns of change in land-use would be reproduced: extensive deforestation and systematic conversion from forest to soy crops and pasture areas for cattle ranching, far above the limits stablished by the Brazilian Forest Code. The project activities are designed to avoid the deforestation drivers that would realize the referred baseline in the without project scenario, with the long-term vision of restoring the relation of local communities of rural workers with the forest areas and contribute with the transition to socioeconomic scenario build on bioeconomy principles. With project activity approval, the proponents intend to improve the mechanisms of remote and in loco surveillance, as well as implement activities that will result in other climate, community, and biodiversity benefits.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
CCB Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use
CCB Project Type: Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation

title: Tlawan kiwi nak chuchit Blue Carbon Mangrove Conservation Project, Conserving Coastal Ecosystems in Veracruz to Support Life
description:
In Mexico, the mangrove areas in the state of Veracruz are significantly impacted by deforestation.  Among the major drivers of the deforestation in the region, it is possible to identify illegal firewood harvesting, logging, dredging, and real estate development.

According to a previous study made for the project proponent, the average deforestation rate in the state of Veracruz is 1.07% for the period of 2005-2015, while in Alvarado region, within this same state, it was 1.5%/year for the same period.

The Project activity is a REDD+ grouped project that intents to address the unplanned deforestation of wetlands in the state of Veracruz.  Currently, there are 37 project activity instances, each one encompassing wetland areas within ejidos or private land.  In the future, more project activity instances, inside state-owned, private or ejidos’ lands, will be added to this grouped project.

Conservation activities include, but are not limited to, reestablishing canals, maintaining canal structures, soil rehabilitation, deforestation monitoring, and monitoring of biodiversity.

The project proponent has been engaging with communities in ejidos and private lands since 2016 under a participatory and inclusive approach and will also include more properties as the project is developed.  BlueMX is also conducting capacity building sessions and developing outreach and communication materials to empower communities to carry out the conservation activities.

The grouped project totals 4,903 hectares of wetlands and is estimated to reduce approximately 65,946 t CO2e per year.

The Project area is not covered by any jurisdictional REDD+ program.

BlueMX is also designing the project for certifying climate, community, and biodiversity benefits under the CCB Programme.

Scenario existing prior to the implementation of the project (the same as baseline scenario):
LFG from Wushan landfill site is emitted to the atmosphere directly.
Equivalent electricity generated by the project is supplied by the CCPG, which is dominated by fossil fuel based power plants.

title: Rwanda Riparian Restoration Project
description:
The Rwanda Riparian Restoration Project is restoring riparian buffer zones in key watersheds and catchment areas within the mountainous areas of Rwanda. These buffer zones serve a critical ecological function as the interface between sensitive upland areas and the water resources that they buffer. The project is using select species of sympodial (clumping) bamboos. These planted bamboo clumps have an intricate underground root system that binds fragile soils and reduces erosion and loss of top soil from sloping agricultural lands. In addition this root system reduces siltation, protecting water resources for downstream users. The multi-dimensional bamboo canopy further serves to reduce the rate and volume of flow of rainfall into rivers reducing flooding, and protecting river banks. 

The planted bamboo is purely for conservation and environmental purposes, while having high carbon emission removal benefits as a permanent and carbon rich ecosystem.

title: Guangxi Tianyang IFM (conversion of logged to protected forest) Project
description:
The Guangxi Tianyang IFM (conversion of logged to protected forest) Project (hereafter “the project activity”) is implemented in Tianyang District, Baise City, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region of China by Guangxi Tianyang Nali Investment & Development Co., Ltd, the geo-coordinate of the  project is  106°22'E -107°08'E and 23°29'N - 24°07'N, the total area is 2373 km2, which includes  the  Improved  Forest  Management  (IFM)  of  the forests in the conversion of logged to protected forest.
The area of the project activity is 10275.04 ha, including 1,915 subcompartments. All these forests are state-owned forests or privately-owned forests or collective-owned forests, and have the legal right to forest ownership. All the owners authorized the project proponent to access the project to their behalf. The species involved in the project are Broad-leaved trees, Chinese fir and Quercus. The forest of the project was older plantations under managing.Before the implantation of the project, the usual type of management was clearcutting.
Before the implementation of the project activity, the trees are logged based on a valid and verifiable government-approved timber management plan for harvesting the project area. The implementation of the project activity converses the trees to protected forest to reduce the GHG emissions for about 1,718,961 tCO2e in 20 years, the average annual emission reduction is 85,948 tCO2e and Verified Carbon Units with buffer deduction is about 1,323,594 tCO2e in 20 years, and average annual VCUs with buffer deduction is 66,179 tCO2e.
The project activity will contribute to the environment (biodiversity conservation, rocky desertification prevention and soil erosion control), thus contribute to sustainable development.

title: Buyi-1 Adjusted Water Management in Rice Cultivation
description:
The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittently flooded conditions during rice cultivation is conducted in the south of Qiannan Buyi and Miao Autonomous Prefecture (hereinafter “Qiannan Prefecture”), Guizhou Province, China, with a total acreage of 19,299 ha for single-cropping rice. Without the project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the traditional continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by the continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded conditions can emit a large amount of methane because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittently flooded method is more
beneficial to water conservation, production increase, and less methane emission reduction than the continuously flooded.
The implementation of the project is expected to reduce the GHG emissions amounting to 417,977 tCO 2 e in the first seven-year period, with an average annual GHG emission reduction of 59,711 tCO 2 e. The project aims to reduce greenhouse gas and mitigate climate changes, increase rice productivity resulting in higher living standards for local farmers and provide more job opportunities.

title: Lincheng-1 Adjusted Water Management in Rice Cultivation
description:
The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittently flooded conditions during rice cultivation is conducted in the southwest of Guiyang City, Guizhou Province, China, with a total acreage of 19,507 ha for single-cropping rice. Without the project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the traditional continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by the continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded conditions can emit a large amount of methane because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittently flooded method is more beneficial to water conservation, production increase, and less methane emission reduction than the continuously flooded.
The implementation activities of the project include cement ditch construction, reservoir construction, pumps and valves installation, training, etc. According to the needs of rice growth, farmers use pumps and valves to control irrigation and drainage, which not only saves water resources but also reduces methane emissions from soil organic matter under anaerobic conditions. Through the pumps and valves, the necessary water can be supplied to the rice paddies in time in the dry season, and the excess water can be drained from the rice paddies in the rainy season. In this case, the methane emission can be declined by an average of 48%. Hence, with the proposed project activity, an estimated amount of GHG emission reduction of 3.06 tCO2e/ha for rice.
The implementation of the project is expected to reduce the GHG emissions amounting to 417,515 tCO2e in the first seven-year period, with an average annual GHG emission reduction of 59,645 tCO2e. The project aims to reduce greenhouse gas and mitigate climate changes, increase the rice productivity resulting in higher living standards of local farmers and provide more job opportunities.

title: INDIA CARBON PROGRAM:AWD/DSR
description:
India is one of the world's largest producers of rice and exporter of rice in the world. Rice cultivation is the most important agricultural operation in India, not only in terms of food security but also in terms of livelihood and plays a major part in the economy. It is a known fact that rice fields emit methane into the environment that contributes to global warming.
The project plans to promote improved water management practices in rice cultivation instead of using the traditional practice of continuously flooded irrigation. AWD/DSR are proven methods to reduce methane emission by as much as 48% compared to flooded conditions where large amounts of methane (CH4) gets generated because of anaerobic decomposition. This project is expected to generate important co-benefits of reducing water usage during rice cultivation, decrease pest and disease attacks, improve soil health etc. Further they are also beneficial for reduced cost of cultivation for small land holders.
In the first instance, the project is planned to be implemented in 8,112 hectares in Punjab and Haryana States.  During the project implementation, relevant technical training and advisory was provided for the farmers to help them conduct AWD/DSR during rice cultivation.
The total GHG emissions reductions due to the implementation of the project activity is estimated to be 380,225  tCO2e over 7 years.
VCS Proponent:
Nurture Agtech Private Limited
Karnataka, India
VCS Project Status: Registration and verification approval request denied
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: TabasCO2 Afforestation Project
description:
The TabasCO2 Afforestation Project covers 3,762 hectares of land, adjacent to livestock areas, where forest plantations will be established to obtain wood products of great value and duration, in addition to capturing large amounts of carbon dioxide (CO2) atmospheric. The project is established in the State of Tabasco, Mexico.
The project will result in a significant contribution to the sustainable development of Mexico, mainly through: i) increased employment and quality of employment; ii) rural development (decentralization); iii) increase in the gross value of production; iv) improvement of fiscal balance; v) preservation of biodiversity and vi) improvement and preservation of soil quality.

title: Spectra Solar Park Ltd _35 MW AC Grid-Tied by Spectra Solar Park Limited
description:
Implemented with the objective of generating clean energy (electricity) by harnessing renewable energy (solar) resources and curbing emission of greenhouse gas, the proposed project activity by Spectra Solar Park Limited includes deployment of grid connected Solar Power projects with cumulative capacity of 35 MW (commissioned on 12 th March 2021) . A summary description of the technologies/ measures to be implemented by the project. The 35 MW grid tied solar power project comprising of Solar PV module (Poly crystalline), grid tied inverter, power transformer , power evacuation infrastructure, energy metering points, switch yar ds and other civil constructions is implemented at a site where no other power plant was operating prior to the implementation of the project activity (green field power plant). Electricity generated from the project activity is supplied to Bangladesh Power Development Board , thus substitutes high carbon intensive grid electricity by clean and renewable based electricity. Location of the project. The 35 MW solar Power Project is located at Shibaloy, Upazila of Manikgang District under Dhaka Division of Ba ngladesh . The detailed location is provided in section 1.12 of this Explanation on how the project is expected to generate GHG emission reductions The electricity supplied to the Bangladesh grid from the operational solar power plant, thus replaces /displaces the feeding of equivalent amount of electricity generated from the operation of existing grid connected power plants (mostly fossil fuel based) and anthropogenic emissions of greenhouse gases (GHGs) associated with its generation. Since the project activity is a green
field power generation initiative, therefore in accordance to the applied methodology the baseline to the project activity is “electricity delivered to the grid by the operation of grid connected power plants and by the addi tion of new generation sources”,
VCS Proponent:
Spectra Solar Park Limited
Bangladesh, Bangladesh

title: Sustainable agricultural practices for carbon sequestration by Organic and Natural farming groups
description: The Agricultural Land Management project in the state of Karnataka, India aims at eliminating the dependence on chemical fertilizers by replacing it with environment friendly organic-based soil amendments. The project involves active participation of various Organic and Natural farming groups. The project activity aims at increasing the capacity of the soil to sequester carbon and enhance nutrients through adoption of sustainable management practices such as agro-forestry, mulching, green manure, vermicomposting etc. The project also holistically aims at achieving sustainable management practices which not only reduces greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions but also bring improvement to farmer livelihood and entire rural ecosystem.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Baowan Adjusted Water Management in Rice Cultivation
description:
The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation is conducted in Baoqing Town and Wanjinshan Township within Shuangyashan City, Heilongjiang Province of China, with a total acreage of 21,073 ha for single-cropping rice. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittent flooded method is more beneficial to water conservation, production increase and methane emission reduction than the continuously flooded.
This project solved the problems of excessive water used during rice cultivation which results in not only large amount of methane (CH4) emissions but also low rice productivity by replacing the continuously flooded method with intermittent flooded method, which shortens the period of anaerobic decomposition of soil organic matter. In this case, the CH4 emission can be declined by an average of 48%1 . Hence, with the proposed project activity, an estimated amount of GHG emission reduction 2.84 tCO2e/ha for single-cropping rice is expected.
The implementation of the project is expected to reduce the GHG emissions amounting to 419,307 tCO2e in the first 7 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 59,901tCO2e.
This project aims to:
- Sequester greenhouse gas and mitigate climate changes;
- Increase the rice productivity resulting in higher living standard of local farmers;
- Provide more job opportunities, especially women workers.
VCS Proponent:

title: Chaoyang Adjusted Water Management in Rice Cultivation
description:
The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation is conducted in Chaoyang Town within Shuangyashan City, Heilongjiang Province of China, with a total acreage of 20,697 ha for single-cropping rice. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittent flooded method is more beneficial to water conservation, production increase and methane emission reduction than the continuously flooded.
This project solved the problems of excessive water used during rice cultivation which results in not only large amount of methane (CH4) emissions but also low rice productivity by replacing the continuously flooded method with intermittent flooded method, which shortens the period of anaerobic decomposition of soil organic matter. In this case, the CH4 emission can be declined by an average of 48%1 . Hence, with the proposed project activity, an estimated amount of GHG emission reduction 2.88 tCO2e/ha for single-cropping rice is expected.
The implementation of the project is expected to reduce the GHG emissions amounting to 417,662 tCO2e in the first 7 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 59,666tCO2e.
This project aims to:
- Sequester greenhouse gas and mitigate climate changes;
- Increase the rice productivity resulting in higher living standard of local farmers;
- Provide more job opportunities, especially women workers.
VCS Proponent:
Harbin Huanyu Agricultural Technology Co., Ltd.
Heilongjiang, China

title: Shaanxi Shiquan Improved Forest Management Project
description:
The Shaanxi Shiquan Improved Forest Management Project (hereafter referred to as “the project”) is located in Shiquan County, Ankang City, Shaanxi Province, P.R.China. It is implemented by China Carbon Sinks Holdings Limited (hereafter “PP”) to protect the once logging forest. The proposed project is implemented in Raofeng Town. 

Prior to the implementation of the project, Forests in the project area were harvested following the guidelines in Timber Harvest Plan approved by the local forestry authority. In order to protect the forest ecosystem, improve the ecological environment, increase carbon sinks, reduce GHG emission reductions and slow down climate change, the project proponent decided to implement this improved forest management project activities from December 2017 to December 2047. And from the Project Start Date, PP has stopped the commercial logging in the project area.

This project aims to protect 4,494 ha commercial forest from logging. The Forest Conservation Project activities will be focused on forest resource supervision and monitoring. In order to supervise and monitor any disturbances that may affect the whole forest, a ranger team has been established to monitor the state of the forest with regard to diseases, illegal logging, hunting, fires etc. This ecosystem will then continue to provide its services to all the communities and entities that depend on it. 

The project activity will significantly improve the forest management conditions within the project area, and benefit local ecological environment. The implementation of the project will not only achieve a reliable measurable carbon sequestration by reducing commercial timer, but also contribute to sustainable development of the local community, host country.

title: Guangxi Cenxi IFM (conversion  of  logged  to  protected  forest)  Project
description:
The Guangxi Cenxi IFM (conversion of logged to protected forest) Project (hereafter “the project activity”) is implemented in Cenxi City, Wuzhou City, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region of China by Cenxi Rural Investment Co ., Ltd, the geo-coordinate of the  project is  110°3’E -111°22’E and 22°37’N - 23°13’N, which includes  the  Improved  Forest  Management  (IFM)  of  the forests in the conversion of logged to protected forest.
The area of the project activity is 25,044.58 ha, including 9,138 subcompartments. 
All these forests are state-owned forests or privately-owned forests or collective-owned forests, and have the legal right to forest ownership. All the owners authorized the project proponent to access the project to their behalf. The specie involved in the project is Pinus massoniana. The forest of the project was older plantations under managing. The age of Pinus massoniana was 10-17. Before the implantation of the project, the usual type of management was clearcutting.
Before the implementation of the project activity, the trees are logged based on a valid and verifiable government-approved timber management plan for harvesting the project area. The implementation of the project activity converses the trees to protected forest to reduce the GHG emissions for about 4,452,235 tCO2e in 20 years, the average annual emission reduction is 222,611 tCO2e and Verified Carbon Units with buffer deduction is about 3,428,219 tCO2e in 20 years, and average annual VCUs with buffer deduction is 171,410 tCO2e.
The project activity will contribute to the environment (biodiversity conservation, rocky desertification prevention and soil erosion control), thus contribute to sustainable development.
VCS Proponent:
Cenxi Rural Investment Co ., Ltd
Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Jiangxi Poyang Improved Forest Management Project
description:
The Jiangxi Poyang Improved Forest Management Project (hereafter referred to as “the project”) is located in Poyang County, Shangrao City, Jiangxi Province, P.R.C. The geo-coordinated of the project site is 116°23′45″-117°06′15″E and 28°46′26″-29°42′03″N, total area is 7070.3 ha. It is implemented by Jiangxi Tianye Biotechnology Limited (PP) to protect the once logging forest. The project avoids emissions by converting logged forests into protected forests, which will achieve sustainable carbon sequestration at the same time. 

The proposed project is implemented in Xiangshuitan Township, Xiejiatan Town, Houjiagang Township, and Jiantianjie Township in Poyang County. The project has 7070.3 ha commercial forest. Prior to the implementation of the project, the forest within the project area was designed and planted as commercial forest, and logged annually according to the Timber Harvest Plan issued by Poyang Forestry Bureau. Since the project started in December 2017, the commercial harvest has been cancelled and only tending and managing is allowed based on approved timber management plan for harvesting the project area. 

The project is expected to generate approximately about 1,528,383 tCO2e in 30 years, and average annual VCUs with buffer deduction is 50,946 tCO2e.

The project activity will significantly improve the forest management conditions within the project area, and benefit local ecological environment. The implementation of the project will not only achieve a reliable measurable carbon sequestration by reducing forest logging, but also contribute to sustainable development of the local community and host country.

title: Adjusted Water Management in Rice Cultivation in South Wuhua County
description: The main goal of this project is changing continuously flooded irrigation to intermittent flooded irrigation in rice cultivation in the south of Wuhua County, Meizhou City, Guangdong Province of China. Wuhua County is located in east of Guangdong Province. The project includes 4 towns, namely Mianyang Town, Meilin Town, Huayang town and Longcun town, with total double-cropping rice area is approximately 7,127.43ha. Since lack of financial support, it is very difficult to change irrigation method by local farmers. Therefore, the baseline scenario should be recognized as continuously flooded irrigation situation. Due to the anaerobic decomposition, a large amount of CH4 will be produced during continuously flooded irrigation. In contrast, rice paddies intermittently submerged and dried so that the upper soil layers switch from anaerobic to aerobic conditions several times during the crop growing season in intermittent flooded method. Moreover, the intermittent flooded method brings many benefits, such as the higher rice yield production, the higher methane removal rate, etc. In project area, every farmer who owns rice paddy field is regarded as an individual unit. With the project implementation, the cement ditches, reservoirs and relevant technical training are provided for these farmers to help them conduct the intermittent flooded water regime during rice cultivation. During intermittent flooded irrigation, the controllable irrigation and drainage system will be applied, which can not only save water resources but also reduce methane emission in anaerobic condition (in flooded phase).

title: ZhaoQu Afforestation Project
description:
ZhaoQu Afforestation Project (hereafter refer to as “the project”) is located within Zhaotong City and Qujing City, Yunan Province of China. It is an inland province, bordering Guizhou to the eest, Sichuan to the northwest. The province has a total population of 46.9 million. The project aims to plant native species on suitable land for forest  for GHG removal whilst contributing to local sustainable development goals.
36,607 ha (549,105 Mu ) of forest was planted on suitable land for forest in Zhaotong City and Qujing City which used to be poor sustainable ecological environment and karst rocky desertification. Prior to the project, the project area was suitable land for forest, there is no forestry management and the coverage by planting trees is low, and there has never been any activity affecting the local ecosystem . By checking the afforestation plan with the forestry bureau of Zhaotong City and Qujing City, it was confirmed that, a small number of trees have been planted in some project area before the project started, but the coverage by planting trees is low. So considering the low forest coverage, the forestry bureau of Zhaotong City and Qujing City determined that the project area is suitable for afforestation after investigation, then the local forestry bureau approved the supplementary planting without disturbing the existing trees in January 2019 to increase the vegetative cover.

title: Western Amazon REDD+ Grouped Project
description:
The WARG Project is an initiative led by Carbon Credits Consulting SRL and a group of landowners in the state of Acre to protect multiple parcels of precious native forest. The project gives landowners with small and medium sized properties the opportunity to participate in a REDD+ project which will bring biodiversity, community, and climate benefits to their land.
The project areas are in the region known as the Amazon deforestation arc and are located in a region of high conversion rates from original forest habitat to pasture and/or large areas of agricultural crops. 
The Brazilian economy in the south of the Amazonian regions, has been based based on native forest clearing to allow cattle-ranching, often without appropriate management technologies. Considering the infertile soil in the Amazon Forest, its exposure to the weather, and to little improvement in agricultural technology the region is hampered by low productivity, leading to increasing deforestation to ensure profitability. 
The WARG project intends to deliver significant improvements in the area’s monitoring, with remote sensing technology implementation to identify any signs of modification in the Project Area and surroundings, in addition to training staff for field monitoring. The project will also be implementing satellite wildfire detection systems and teams of fire fighters to detect fires early before they reach an unmanageable size.
The project is expected to avoid the emission of 3,620,766 tCO2eq in the first 10 years. The actual project area is 60,000 ha of native forest divided in 22 properties, with an ambitious target for continuous expansion to a total area of 500,000 ha.
Finally, the project has been protecting the Brazilian Big Five which include the giant anteater, the giant armadillo, the maned wolf, the puma, and the jaguar on top of a multitude of other endangered animal and plant species.

title: MOZBLUE: BUILDING AFRICA’S LARGEST MANGROVE RESTORATION PROJECT
description:
Mozambique has some of the largest intact mangrove forests in Africa, with more than 60% located along coastal stretches of the Zambezia and Sofala provinces.
 
However, these areas have also experienced significant mangrove cover loss amounting to more than 30,000 ha over the last three decades, primarily due to anthropogenic factors.  The consequences of this degradation include soil erosion, the loss of coastal protection, reduced fish stocks, and loss of biodiversity.
 
Within Zambezia and Sofala, the Blue Forest MozBlue project will restore over 30,000 hectares of degraded mangroves which have been identified through remote sensing, confirmed by ground-truthing, and will be developed under the Wetlands Restoration and Conservation guidelines.
 
The project will utilize local restoration experts to plant mangrove species that occur naturally within the project area and will engage local communities over the 60-year life of the project to actively monitor and maintain the areas once restored.

title: Alto Xingu Grouped REDD+ Project
description:
The primary objective of the Alto Xingu Grouped REDD+ Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD), consisting of Amazon rainforest and Cerrado, the latter known as the Brazilian savannah. The project area occupies both biomes, and the first instance is composed by 4 private properties, with a project area of 14,059.02 ha, which are located in Paranatinga municipality, at Mato Grosso State.

Beyond the project’s ecological and carbon benefits, a proportion of the carbon credits generated will be dedicated to improving the social and environmental conditions in the project region, specifically contributing to improving deforestation control, and developing environmental education and other social activities. The contribution to sustainability is being monitored through the application of the SOCIALCARBON® Standard.

The present REDD project is expected to avoid a predicted 5,942.90  ha of deforestation, equating to 1,362,087  tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime (19-July-2021 to 18-July-2051).
VCS Proponent:
Ecológica Assessoria Ltda.
Tocantins, Brazil
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Jiangxi Dingnan Improved Forest Management Project
description:
Jiangxi Dingnan Improved Forest Management Project (hereafter referred to as “the project”) is located in Dingnan County, Ganzhou City, Jiangxi Province, P.R.C. The geo-coordinated of the project proponent is 114°48′～115°23′E, 25°3′～24°41′N, total area is 7,955.3 ha. It is implemented by Jiangxi Tianye Biotechnology Limited to protect the once logging forest. The project avoids emissions by converting logged forests into projected forests, which will achieve sustainable carbon sequestration at the same time. 
The proposed project is implemented in 6 Towns and 3 Forest Farms. Prior to the implementation of the project, Forests in the project area were harvested following the guidelines in Timber Harvest Plan approved by the local forestry bureau. In order to protect the forest ecosystem, improve the ecological environment, increase carbon sinks, reduce GHG emission reductions and slow down climate change, the project proponent decided to implement this improved forest management project activities from March 2018 to February 2048. And from the Project Start Date, PP has stopped the commercial logging in the project area.
This project aims to protect 7,955 ha commercial forest from logging. The Forest Conservation Project activities will be focused on forest resource supervision and monitoring. In order to supervise and monitor any disturbances that may affect the whole forest, PP has established a ranger team that monitors the state of the forest with regard to diseases, illegal logging, hunting, fires etc. This ecosystem will then continue to provide its services to all the communities and entities that depend on it.
The project is expected to generate approximately 1,812,936 tCO2e with buffer deduction during the 30 years’ crediting period, with the annual emission reductions of 60,431 tCO2e. 
The project activity will significantly improve the forest management conditions within the project area, benefit local ecological environment and sustainable development.

title: NIGER DELTA MANGROVE PROJECT
description: This is the first Blue Carbon Project of Niger Delta Mangroves. It is a grouped project whose expansion region includes all the mangrove forests present in the Niger Delta in Nigeria. This project is aiming at restoring and sustainably managing the Niger Delta mangroves. Niger Delta mangroves together with the creeks and rivers are a major source of food and livelihood for about 30 million people, which represents more than 17% of Nigeria's population. Other ecosystem services provided by this unique environment are flood control, ground water re-fill, reservoir of biodiversity, fuel wood, cultural values etc. This ecosystem also plays important role in climate change mitigation because of its high blue carbon sequestration potential. Mangroves constitute important nurseries for fishes, crustaceans, sponges, algae and other invertebrates, and also acts as a sink, retaining pollutants from contaminated tidal water. Mangroves are also used as shelter and breeding grounds by small mammals, shore birds, reptiles, and insects. Unfortunately, this unique ecosystem is on the decline and at the verge of been totally lost. Mangrove forests are converted to farmlands and the trees are cut for timber, fuel, house construction and so on. Consequently, many coastal communities in the Niger Delta are losing their lives and primary livelihoods due to increased vulnerability to floods as a result of the disappearance of mangroves which usually serve as defense in times of coastal flooding. They are also now exposed to the high intensity of sunlight and heat waves as the land lay bare of trees to regulate sun rays. There is an urgent need to restore/conserve the mangroves of Niger Delta region. Hence the main objective of the project is sequestration of greenhouse gases (GHGs) through planting activities.

everi GmbH
Hamburg, Germany

title: Displacement of firewood by household biogas stoves in India
description:
The project activity aims to  replace commonly used inefficient wood fired mud stoves thereby replacing firewood consumption. 
The household biogas plants utilize cattle dung in the digester to produce biogas which is burnt in gas stoves for household cooking’s. This leads to reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by displacing conventionally used non-renewable biomass with renewable biogas. In addition, the hygienic conditions in the rural areas will be improved by an appropriate disposal of waste. Further, residue from the bio digesters can be used as organic fertilizer and will improve soil fertility in rural areas.

title: Red Sea Power Wind Farm
description:
The project consists of the construction and operation of a greenfield 58.9MW wind power plant near the Lake of Ghoubet, Djibouti. It involves the setting up of wind turbines which will produce electricity for export to the national grid through EDD ( Electricity of Djibouti).
The wind power plant, Djibouti’s first utility scale wind park, is built and owned b y Red Sea Power Limited SAS , a simplified limited liability company incorporated under the laws of the Republic of Djibouti, registered within the Commercial Registry of Djibouti Number 15366/B/SAS , a Djiboutian registered
company owned by the Africa Finan ce Corporation ( 51%), the Great Horn Investment Holdings ( 1,
FMO Entrepreneurial Development Bank (19.5%) and Climate Investor One (CIO) (
Djibouti imports over
7 0% of its energy from Ethiopia , dominated by hydropower plants, while the local energy generation solely comes from diesel fueled power capac it ies . The project will th us substitute grid electricity by renewable energy and cut down GHG emissions from baseline fossil fuel intensive grid mix.
Apart from emission reductions, the ben efits of the project comprise, among others, improvement of energy self sufficiency of the country, as well as creation of local employment.
It responds to the objectives of
Djibouti as stated in its INDCs committing the country to increase the share of r enewables in electricity production to 10 0%, as echoed in the National Energy Policy of 2013 in alignment with Vision 2035
The project’s 59.8 MW will generate approximately 2 42 GWh per year GWh per year and 988,499 tCO2e of emission reductions over the ten years cred iting period i.e. 98,849 t CO2e of emission reductions per year

title: Yantai Xinhao Swine Farm Manure Management System GHG Mitigation Project
description:
Yantai Xinhao Swine Farm Animal Manure Management System GHG Mitigation Project (hereinafter referred to as the Project) introduce animal waste management system (AWMS) to swine farms in Yadi village, Muping District, Yantai City, Shandong Province, China, which are owned by Yantai Xinhao agriculture and animal husbandry Co., Ltd (hereinafter called” Xinhao”). The purpose of the project activity is to treat the manure and wastewater from the swine farm to avoid methane emissions generated in the baseline uncovered anaerobic lagoons. 
In this project, AWMS is built to replace the traditional open anaerobic lagoons, and swine farm installed one AWMS. The manure and waster will be collected into the anaerobic digesters and then biogas generated during the anaerobic treatment process will be captured and total 1,450*104 m3 biogas are expected to be generated annually. Biogas is then sent into biogas boilers for heat production. Every biogas boiler has been installed in each swine farms. All of the heat generated are used by AWMSs and the swine farms, while the rest (if any) will be burned. The sludge produced after fermentation is applied to corn fields as fertilizer, and the wastewater produced by anaerobic biogas digesters is used for agricultural irrigation. 
Benefited from the “waste-biogas-fertilizer” pattern, harmlessness and ecological utilization of the swine manure can be realized. All the heat generated by the project will be used by the AWMSs and the swine farm. The heat generated will not be connected to other users or the regional heating supply system, and the baseline emissions associated with heat generation will not be claimed. 
The project activity will reduce of GHG in the atmosphere through avoiding methane emissions from anaerobic treatment of swine manure and wastewater. The project is expected to achieve an annual emission reduction of 105,655 tCO2e and a total emission reduction of 739,585 tCO2e in the first crediting period.
VCS Proponent:
Yantai Xinhao agriculture and animal husbandry Co., Ltd.
Shandong Province, China

title: ReforesTerra Grouped Project
description:
The ReforesTerra grouped project aims to recover low-intensity and degraded pasturelands in the Baixo Rio Jamari watershed in the State of Rondônia, Brazil, in the Southern Amazon region. The first project activity instance consists of the reforestation of 2,000 hectares in smallholdings. Available data indicates a potential for reforestation over 20,000 hectares in the watershed.

Through the reforestation of degraded lands in Permanent Protection Areas (PPAs) surrounding water bodies and in Legal Reserves (LRs) in other areas of the engaged landholdings, the grouped project aims to protect water resources and reintroduce native tree species. Additionally, the project is expected to benefit to 600 landholders in the first instance through capacity building and Payment for Ecosystem Services, as well as employing 37 local people full time and 12 other professionals in the region part time, with equal job opportunities for women and men. The first project activity instance will remove 805,304 tCO2e over the 30-year crediting period.

title: AGRICULTURAL LAND MANAGEMENT PROJECT IN BARWANI DISTRICT  (MADHYA PRADESH), INDIA BY GODREJ AGROVET LTD
description:
The proposed VCS ALM (Agricultural Land Management) project activity aims at developing a carbon sequestration project funded by Godrej Agrovet Ltd. (GAVL) in the watershed areas of Barwani district, Madhya Pradesh in collaboration with NABARD (National Bank for  Agriculture and Rural Development) Integrated Watershed Development Programme (IWDP). The project integrates adoption of Sustainable Agricultural Land Management (SALM) practices in the context of watershed development (as per NABARD WDF Guidelines) activities. The project is implementing on the five village watersheds viz Mansoor, Mohaliya pani, Sidri, Sulgaon and Wajhar of the Niwali Block of the District, Barwani, which is the part of the major River Kajalmata and comes under the ‘Kajalmata Watershed Project’. The identified watershed villages are most suitable for the project activity (SALM Farming) intervention as it is reported with extensive agriculture activities, but with high levels of soil erosion & degradation and falls under the IX th Agro climatic regions i.e. Western Plateau and Hills. The project activity achieves Godrej’s (Godrej Agrovet Ltd. GAVL), sustainability goal of 
‘Good & Green by 2025’ which ensures the carbon neutrality and water positivity as the target’s needs. The project is implementing through in active participation with the NGO AKRSP(I) (AGA KHAN RURAL SUPPORT PROGRAMME (INDIA)), the concerned Project  Implementing Agency (PIA) for the SALM project implementation in the watershed areas. The estimate of annual average GHG reductions and removals through adoption of SALM practices in the agricultural landscape is 23154 tCO2e and for the first renewal crediting period of 20 years the total reductions estimations are 463074 tCO2e. The Project activities are carried out and monitored according to approved VCS methodology VM0017: Adoption of Sustainable Agricultural Land Management.

Godrej Agrovet Limited

title: Fujian longyan IFM (conversion of logged to protected forest) Project
description:
The Improved Forest Management (IFM) project activity is located in Xinluo District, Longyan City, Fujian Province of China. The annual average temperature is 16 ~ 20 ℃, and the annual rainfall is 1500 ~ 1900 mm.
The project activity includes the Improved Forest Management (IFM) of the forest in 1475 subcompartments spreading over Baisha Town, Wan’an Town and Shizhong Town by the conversion of logged to protected forest. All the subcompartments had the legal right to harvest issued by local forest bureau before the implementation of the project activity. Before 2018， they were all forests which the trees could be logged and sold once reached the cutting rotation age based on a timber harvest plan. After 2017, they are all converted to protected forests. The Hangzhou Chaoteng Energy Technology Co., Ltd is in charge of applying VCS project.
The project activity is to protect the previously harvested forests. Community residents can become our employees, and their job is to protect the forest. The local forestry bureau can supervise the implementation of the project and ensure that there is no commercial logging in our project. In addition, organizations in the community and all sectors of society can supervise our project and make complaints and suggestions through the risk control department.
The purpose of strata is to improve accuracy and reduce the sampling cost. The strata are usually based on the tree species, age and canopy density, but it does not mean all these factors should be considered for all projects, more strata mean more workload and cost. For this project, the factor of species for strata could reduce the variation within the same stratum and reach the accuracy level of 90% under certain degree of freedom. So the strata are reasonable and feasible. All the subcompartments are divided into 3 strata based on the tree species.

title: Duzce Landfill Gas (LFG) Capture and Utilization Project
description:
In order to develop a municipal solid waste management system that will be environmentally friendly and sustainable, Duzce Landfill Gas (LFG) Capture and Utilization Project is being implemented by Envio Enerji Üretim A.Ş.. The project activity is a Methane Gas Power Generating Plant with an installed capacity of 2,824 MWe. The project was commissioned with the generation of electricity from October 31st, 2020, which is regarded as the project start date. The project's lifetime is 29 years, according to the contracts with the Düzce Province Solid Waste Association Presidency and EMRA Generation License. Also, the facility has a mechanical separation plant with 250 tons/day capacity. The sorting facility distributes the waste into organics. The separated organic fraction is taken for the controlled anaerobic digestion (biological treatment tanks) together with the organic waste received by the facility. The methane recovered from digestion will be combusted through gas engines together with the recovered LFG and the electricity is fed into the grid. The solid organic output of the Biodigester is sent to the Landfill area. After sorting, wastes such as paper, glass, cardboard, metal, and plastic, which are called packaging wastes, are separated and brought into the economy by recycling.
The project is located in In Duzce Yığılca road, in Hecinler locality, in Duzce /Turkey. This project adopts a crediting period of 7 years. The expected average annual emission reductions are 31,122 tCO2eq/y. Accordingly, the project is expected to generate 217,852  tCO2eq emissions reduction throughout its first crediting period.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents

title: Changlinyan Adjusted Water Management in Rice Cultivation
description:
The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation is conducted in Changlinyan within Jiamusi City, Heilongjiang Province of China, with a total acreage of 20,012 ha for single-cropping rice. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittent flooded method is more beneficial to water conservation, production increase and methane emission reduction than the continuously flooded.
This project solved the problems of excessive water used during rice cultivation which results in not only large amount of methane (CH4) emissions but also low rice productivity by replacing the continuously flooded method with intermittent flooded method, which shortens the period of anaerobic decomposition of soil organic matter. In this case, the CH4 emission can be declined by an average of 48%1 . Hence, with the proposed project activity, an estimated amount of GHG emission reduction 2.92 tCO2e/ha for single-cropping rice is expected.
The implementation of the project is expected to reduce the GHG emissions amounting to 409,493 tCO2e in the first 7 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 58,499tCO2e.
This project aims to:
- Sequester greenhouse gas and mitigate climate changes;
- Increase the rice productivity resulting in higher living standard of local farmers;
- Provide more job opportunities, especially women workers.
VCS Proponent:
Harbin Huanyu Agricultural Technology Co., Ltd.
Heilongjiang, China
CCB Proponent:
Harbin Huanyu Agricultural Technology Co., Ltd.
Heilongjiang, China

title: Conservation and restoration of the tropical dry forest of the north coast of Peru
description:
The REDD+ project is implemented in the area comprised by 3 natural protected areas, which are the Tumbes National Reserve, Cerros de Amotape National Reserve and El Angolo Hunting Reserve (except the concessioned area: hunting club Coto El Angolo), the same that are located in the regions of Tumbes and Piura.
These regions are located in the noth-eastern part of the Peruvian coast, bounded by the neighbouring country of Ecuador (to the north and east), the Pacific Ocean (to the west) and the Lambayeque region by the south. Both regions have their own specific and variable characteristics throughout and up their territories, since they present part of the Andes Mountain range, high jungle, paramo, equatorial dry forest, tropical valleys, and are an area of permanent interaction between the cold Humboldt Ocean Currents and warm El Niño currents throughout the year.
The project area has an extension of 202,812.54 ha and its aim is to conserve forest in the 3 protected natural areas from the imminent advance of deforestation and degradation.
The project it is proposed to reduce the pressure to change land use in the project area through 3 activities: 1) Support in the implementation of land use plans, 2) Control and surveillance, Forest conservation and restoration, 3) Sustainable intensification of agriculture on existing agricultural land, y 4) Initiatives of aquaculture, tourism and beekeeping activities.
With these actions, the project expects to avoid a total of 5,612,131 tCO2-e according to the baseline scenario projected for the first 10-year period, with an annual average of net emissions of 561,213  tCO2-e. In addition, the project includes benefits for the populations involved as well as for the conservation of biodiversity, where it seeks to contribute to the conservation of forests with high levels of biodiversity with presence of endemic species, species in danger of extinction or with some degree of threat, beyond the benefits of reducing GHG emissions.

title: Cenzcouh Water Management with Rice Cultivation
description: The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation is conducted in Quanzhou County, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, where located in southwestern China with a total acreage of 11,960 ha for double-cropping rice. The project area contains the project fields of rice merely, and the data of total area is confirmed by the Agricultural Bureau of Quanzhou County. The project is expected to reduce GHG emissions by replacing continuously flooded method with intermittent flooded method. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, this method can reduce the flooded time of rice in the whole growth cycle and the methane (CH4) emissions, and is more beneficial to production increase than the continuously flooded as well. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the backward continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario.

Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, this method can reduce the flooded time of rice in the whole growth cycle and the methane (CH4) emissions, and is more beneficial to production increase than the continuously flooded as well. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the backward continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario.
