title: Shanxi Qinyuan Afforestation Project
description:
Shanxi Qinyuan Afforestation Project (hereafter as “the project”) is located in Qinyuan County, Changzhi City, Shanxi Province of China. The aim of the project is to increase carbon sequestration and to contribute to the local sustainable development by planting the trees and shrubs on the barren mountains and barren land.
4,949.40 of forest is about to be planted by direct planting on the barren mountain and barren land in Qinyuan County, and the planted species are all native species including Pinus tabuliformis (Chinese pine), Fraxinus L. (white wax), Prunus davidiana. (wild peach), Acer truncatum (Mono Maple), Armeniaca sibirica (apricot), Quercus Liaotungensis (oak), Forsythia suspensa (Forsythias Fructus) . The implementation of the afforestation project will generate GHG emission removals and mitigate climate change, improve soil and water conservation and forest cover; enhance local biodiversity by increasing the connectivity of forest, and bring income and job opportunities for local communities and residents.

title: Orizon CarbonCrop Rewards Programme
description:
Orizon’s CarbonCrop Programme supports and incentivizes South African farmers/landowners in the transition towards more sustainable agricultural practices by paying out a majority share of the carbon credit revenues resulting from emission reductions and carbon sequestration on our participating project fields. Together with our partners, we support our farmers by providing tailored financial and practical advice, building online tools to assist farmers in their transition, hosting information sessions/webinars and contributing to local research on sustainable agriculture.
The program, with its project boundaries being the geographic boundaries of the Republic of South Africa, will be registered as a grouped project under VM0042 - Methodology for Improved Agricultural Land Management. Each project activity will be carried out and monitored according to this methodology and its supporting methodologies, standards, and tools. Over time this project will include various types of farming practices /land types by adding instances that meet the additionality and applicability conditions as per the methodology.
Our vision is to be a comprehensive partner for our current and future farmers in their regenerative journey, support further research and investment into Regenerative Agriculture (“RA”) and to ultimately help drive a national shift to improve soil health and productivity to secure the long-term future of agriculture in South Africa.
VCS Proponent:
Orizon Agriculture (Pty) Ltd
Johannesburg, South Africa

title: HUILONG AREA DEQING COUNTY METHANE EMISSION REDUCTION IN RICE CULTIVATION PROJECT
description: Huilong Area Deqing County Methane Emission Reduction in Rice Cultivation Project (hereafter referred to “the project” or “project”) is located in Huilong area, Deqing County, Zhaoqing City, Guangdong Province, China. The project activity consists of the implementation of an intermittent irrigation system to replace the traditional continuous flooding method in double-season rice cultivation in order to improve water management and reduce methane emissions from the paddy fields. The project utilizes cement ditches, pumps and vales to enable farmers to switch from continuously flooded to intermittently flooded conditions for the rice cultivation paddy fields. The intermittent irrigation also contributes to enhancing the grain yield and conserving water resources thus improving the sustainability of the cropland production. The project involves a total cultivated agricultural area about 5,428 hectares in Huilong Area, Deqing County.

title: Methane avoidance in rice cultivation in Northeast of Yueyang County
description:
Yueyang County, which is located on the shore of Dongting Lake, is one of the major rice producing districts in China, has a population about 714,615, and annual household income of farmers is only CNY 27,733 . The project is located in Northeast of Yueyang County, Yueyang City, Hunan Province, China, with a total acreage of 7,907.66 ha for double-cropping rice. The project activity is designed to construction the cement ditch and reservoir to realize the reducing of methane emissions by conducting intermittently flooded method instead of continuously flooded method during the cropping season in Northeast of Yueyang County.
In the baseline scenario, farmers in Yueyang County use continuously flooded method in rice paddies with the straw on field as the organic amendment inputs, which means fields have standing water throughout the rice growing season and only dry out for harvest. However, the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition. In the project scenario, farmers in Yueyang County changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation. By controlled the irrigation and drainage according to the needs of rice growth, can save water resources. On the other hand, multiple aeration during rice cultivation can effectively reduce methane emissions from soil organic matter under anaerobic conditions.
VCS Proponent:
Hunan Yueyang Huabanqiao Market Development Co., Ltd.
Hunan Province, China

title: Sichuan Santai Improved Forest Management Project
description:
Sichuan Santai Improved Forest Management Project is located in Santai County, Sichuan Province, China. It is implemented by the representative project owner Santai Shengda Development Co. LTD . The project is to protect the forest that will be logged.
Santai County is located in the north-central part of Sichuan Basin,  30 42 34~31 26 35 N,  104 43 04~105 18 13 E.  Santai County covers an area of 2,659 square kilometers. The area of public welfare forest in forestry land is 305,000 mu. The area of commercial forest is 996,300 mu,  among them, there are 946,700 mu of general timber land. The dominant tree species are mainly cypress. 
The project is implemented in the key location commercial forest of Santai County, which distributes in the 33 towns. For the convenient of VCS registration and issuance application, they selected the Santai Shengda Development Co. LTD to represent them as project proponent to implement the GHG related work. 
The project has about 10,972 ha commercial forest, which is nearly mature or mature. Before the implement of the project, the forest in the project area shall be planted according to the design of commercial forest, and logged annually according to the timber logging and managing plan issued by the local forest authority. The main object of the project is to improve the forest coverage rate, protect local ecological environment, reduce carbon emissions and carbon sequestration by enhance the management level and converse logged to protected forest in the project area. The implementation of the project will result in significant carbon sequestration and improve the sustainable development of ecological system. The project is expected to generate 1,479,171.87 tCO2e emission reductions within the crediting of 20 years starting from 01/09/2019 with the average annual emission reductions of 73,958.59 tCO2e; without buffer deduction, the annual and the total emission reductions are 55,468.94 and 1,109,378.9 tCO2e respectively.
VCS Proponent:
Santai Shengda Development Co. LTD
Sichuan Province, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Carbon Sink Afforestation Project in Tongyu County, Jilin Province
description:
Carbon Sink Afforestation Project (hereafter refer to as “the project”) in Tongyu County, Jilin Province is located in Tongyu County, Baicheng City, Jilin Province, and is organized and constructed by the Forestry and Grass Bureau of Tongyu County. Tongyu County is located in the western part of Jilin Province, adjacent to Inner Mongolia to the west and Heilongjiang to the north, and is located in the Songnen Plain in the east of the Greater Khingan Mountains.
The project aims to establish forests on barren land to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and contribute to local sustainable development.A total of 3,266.04 ha (48,990.6 Mu[ A Chinese metric unit of area, 1ha equals to 15 Mu.]) of forests were planted in 27 townships (towns and farms) in Tongyu County.
The project aims to bring into play the benefits of afforestation and sink, and at the same time, bring into play the multiple benefits of forests in terms of protecting biodiversity, improving local living environment and natural landscape, and increasing community income. Based on the crediting period of 20 years, a total of 1,175,818 tCO2e is expected to be generated by 2035, with an average annual emission reduction of 58,791 tCO2e.

title: PlanTogo
description:
The PlanTogo project aims to establish 120.230 hectares of forest plantations in Maritime , Plateaux and Centrale Regions of Togo, over a period of 10 years (2021 2030). The main forest species to be planted are eucalyptus , khaya and gmelina , the project also considers the planting of other species such as bamboo and cashew .
T he purpose of these plantations is to restore degraded lands in the short term and the sustainable production of goods an services in the medium and long term, while contributing to local development and fight against climate change by sequestering CO2.
The project developer is Sequoia Plantations Togo ( who will implement the plantations under two modalities: i) on their own lands and ii) on communal or smallholders lands to who S PT will provide seedlings and technical assistance. Sequoia Plantations Togo is responsible of project monitoring through the entire crediting period.
SPT is a Grouped Project, and project areas are selected considering the land eligibility requirements of the VCS, that is, on lands where there have been no native ecosystems in the last 10 years and without forest at the beginning of the plantation activities. The areas identified for the first instance are constituted by grasslands and shrublands, and current land use is extensive agriculture or cattle grassing. SPT will allow intercropping in the first years of the plantations.
The reforestation activities proposed by Sequoia Plantations Togo will generate a switch in land covert from non-forest to forest and it will lead to the creation of a carbon stock in biomass and in the soil greater than that existing under current conditions. The Net GHG emission removals expected in 20 years is 1 45 690 569 tCO2e (7 284 528 tCO2e/yr)
VCS Proponent:
Sequoia Plantation Togo
Lome, Togo
CCB Proponent:
Sequoia Plantation Togo
Lome, Togo
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Kruger to Canyons Rangeland Restoration Project
description: The Kruger to Canyons Rangeland Restoration Project is a grouped project located in the globally significant Kruger to Canyons Biosphere Reserve. The area has lost soil carbon due to unrestricted animal movements and high grazing intensities leading to low productivity and bare ground, while this is exacerbated by unfavorable herd structures. Unrestricted grazing is occurring due to a ‘tragedy of the commons’ where communal areas are over-utilized for livestock grazing and knowledge of sustainable grazing practices have lapsed. The project aims to reverse historic rangeland degradation on communal rangelands by introducing rotational grazing through herding and improved animal husbandry, and removing and reducing Greenhouse Gases in the process. Furthermore, project participants will benefit from improved access to livestock markets.
VCS Proponent:
Conservation South Africa
Rondebosch, South Africa
CCB Proponent:
Conservation South Africa
Rondebosch, South Africa
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Methane avoidance in rice cultivation in East of Yueyang County
description:
Yueyang County, which is located on the shore of Dongting Lake, is one of the major rice producing districts in China, has a population about 714,615, and annual household income of farmers is only CNY 27,733. The project is located in East of Yueyang County, Yueyang City, Hunan Province, China, with a total acreage of 8,079.22 ha for double-cropping rice. The project activity is designed to construction the cement ditch and reservoir to realize the reducing of methane emissions by conducting intermittently flooded method instead of continuously flooded method during the cropping season in East of Yueyang County.
In the baseline scenario, farmers in Yueyang County use continuously flooded method in rice paddies with the straw on field as the organic amendment inputs, which means fields have standing water throughout the rice growing season and only dry out for harvest. However, the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane because of anaerobic decomposition. In the project scenario, farmers in Yueyang County changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation. By controlled the irrigation and drainage according to the needs of rice growth, can save water resources. On the other hand, multiple aeration during rice cultivation can effectively reduce methane emissions from soil organic matter under anaerobic conditions.

title: Simao Water Management with Rice Cultivation
description: The project carried out changes from a continuously flooded regime to an intermittently flooded regime during rice cultivation in Mojiang County and Zhenyuan County, Yunnan Province, China, with a total acreage of 11,475 ha of double-cropping rice. Without the project, there would be no ditches, pumps, valves, and reservoirs to conduct the intermittently flooded method, the traditional continuously flooded method would be continued. The original scenario in which rice was cultivated by the continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded conditions can emit a large amount of methane because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittently flooded method is more conducive to saving water, increasing rice yield, and reducing methane emissions than the continuously flooded method.

title: Reforestation of degraded land in Spain
description:
The proposed ARR-VCS project is a large-scale grouped project centered on the reforestation of degraded lands in Spain. According to the country’s National Action Plan for the UNCCD, approx. 74% of Spain is at risk of desertification and 18% of the land is at high risk of becoming irreversibly desert. This grouped project aims for the long-term restoration of Spain’s forests, achieved through native, mixed-species reforestation that reverses the impact of land degradation, prevents the loss of flora and fauna and improves biodiversity. The planting employs the latest technologies and planting techniques to support the permanent establishment of native forests in predicted bioclimates that may benefit rural communities in time. The long term resilience of forest and vegetation composition will be monitored by an extensive monitoring system to track the effectiveness and resilience of project activities.
The project is managed by Land Life, a tech-driven reforestation company that plants trees at scale to restore degraded ecosystems globally in hubs like Europe, the US and Australia. In Spain, Land Life’s local team based in Burgos ensures the boots-on-the-ground and maintains a close collaboration with local partners and authorities. 
Project activities are implemented and monitored according to approved large scale project methodology AR-ACM0003, with more project instances to be added over the coming years (up to 10,000 ha expected). The first set of project instances covers 167.46 ha of degraded land in Spain, at 4 distinct planting sites: Campos, Pancorbo, Villapadierna and Grisel. To date, a total of 147,369 native trees have been planted in the project areas and these will sequester approximately  49,792 tCO2e over a project crediting period of 60 years. Within this time frame, 40 years are accounted for in each project instance due to land agreement contract terms. The estimated annual average of GHG emission removals is 1,245 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent:
Land Life Company B.V.
NH, Netherlands
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Methane avoidance in rice cultivation in East of Junshan District
description:
Junshan District, which is located on the north of Dongting Lake, is one of the major rice producing districts in China, has a population about 246,516, and annual household income of farmers is only CNY 35,932. The project is located in East of Junshan District, Yueyang City, Hunan Province, China, with a total acreage of 7,925.01 ha for double-cropping rice. The project activity is designed to construction the cement ditch and reservoir to realize the reducing of methane emissions by conducting intermittently flooded method instead of continuously flooded method during the cropping season in East of Junshan District.
In the baseline scenario, farmers in Junshan District use continuously flooded method in rice paddies with the straw on field as the organic amendment inputs, which means fields have standing water throughout the rice growing season and only dry out for harvest. However, the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane because of anaerobic decomposition. In the project scenario, farmers in Junshan District changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation. By controlled the irrigation and drainage according to the needs of rice growth, can save water resources. On the other hand, multiple aeration during rice cultivation can effectively reduce methane emissions from soil organic matter under anaerobic conditions.

title: Kwamisa/Other reserves community Forest Project
description:
The Project Activity is planting trees to restore the area, improve biodiversity, improve livelihoods of the local communities around the degraded forests and join the fight against climate change which has become a threat of global warming to the planet. The project will increase the sequestration capacity of carbon dioxide and other Greenhouse gases by increasing the forest and vegetative cover.
The project will contribute to the removal of GHG from the atmosphere. Through the plantation of teak, which is a wood biomass, its implemented on degraded forest reserve. Which without human influence and financial support will remain degraded, especially due to rapid depletion on and off-reserve stocks. This would lead to loss of carbon sinks and the negative climatical conditions will be evidence, impacting the social and economic activities of the region.
The carbon project will be managed by Private Afforestation Developers Organisation (PADO) which is an umbrella Organisation of private forest plantation developers in Ghana. They are the legal owners of the plantations located in Ghana; Kumasi at Kwamisa Forest Reserve located at Offinso Forest District within the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The reserve lies midway between Kumasi-Techiman and the Kumasi–Sunyani Road about 35 miles north of Kumasi.
The ARR activities are carried out and monitored according to approved project methodology AR-ACM0003 (Ver 2.0) for a project period of 40 years. The project expected to remove 26,281 t/CO2e annually and 1,051,223 tCO2e during its entire life.  The project has an goal to achieve forest plantations recovering 3010 hectares (ha) from degraded forest reserve in a total project zone of 5225 ha. The area was a degraded land Prior to the project implementation caused by a serious fire disaster in 1983 which engulfed Ghana and led to   massive forest degradation and severe hunger crisis.

title: Portland: Regenerative Agriculture & native revegetation on degraded land
description:
The project includes both revegetation techniques in and around agricultural land, on different lands of the Republic of South Africa, providing resilient systems to protect the agricultural land from extreme weather events. The project proposes both the IALM and ARR methodologies together, at different GIS delineated areas on each project instance (land), the agricultural methodology will incorporate regenerative agricultural practices as well as circular use of by-products from the farm, as well as neighbouring farms. 
The ARR compartment of the project will include revegetation of native flora around the farm, facilitating ecological resilience to the project instance and sustaining pollinators throughout the year. This will be scaled to vegetation unit specific revegetation activities and regenerative agricultural practices as applicable per the Improved Agricultural Land Management methodology of the Verified Carbon Standard. This project intends to look at the system instead of looking on how to apply a methodology onto the land, a larger look at biota and their interaction in applied stewardship.
The first project instances occur in the Western Cape province, Southern Cape area of Knysna where a matrix landscape of Fynbos (ever-green shrubland, indicative of Mediterranean climates) and Temperate Forest was found historically.

Holmstone Pty. (Ltd.)

title: Restoration and Conservation of Dry Afromontane Forest in the Highlands of Eastern Tigray
description:
This project activity targets the restoration and conservation of 30,000 hectares of degraded and deforested lands in the highlands of eastern Tigray. The project area is located inside the Desa’a State Forest which is a dry Afromontane forest and lies between the Tigrinian plateau and the Afar lowlands (elevation between 3100 and 900 m a.s.l.), stretching along the Western edge of the Great Rift Valley escarpment of Ethiopia. The fragmented forest covers about 154,071 ha and is the largest Afromontane remnant forest in Tigray. The restoration project consists of active planting, assisted natural regeneration and conservation activities. In addition to the forest establishment and protection activities, soil and water conservation activities are implemented, including stone check dams, hill side stone terraces, trenches, small ponds and micro basins. 
It is a community-oriented project, which means that a participatory and inclusive approach is taken with the aim to improve the livelihoods of local communities. The degradation of the ecosystem in the project area is the result of unsustainable use and management over a longer period. These practices of overexploitation were mainly driven by grazing, firewood collection and timber extraction in a context of insufficient law enforcement and resource use planning. The drivers of deforestation are being addressed through a combination of providing alternative livelihood opportunities and improving management and law enforcement capacities. The recovery of the forest will restore the carbon stocks in the vegetation and the soil. A vital component of the project is the conservation and enhancement of biological diversity and the promotion of assisted natural regeneration. The project will result into an estimated GHG removal of in total 4.746.785tCO2-e over a period of 50 years.
VCS Proponent:
WeForest ASBL
Flemish Brabant, Belgium
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Juruá REDD+ Project
description:
Juruá REDD+ Project is a partnership between Biofílica Ambipar Environment and Amazônia Agroindústria EIRELI, in order to foster forest conservation and the reduction of potential greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions based on a local economic development model that values the “standing” forest through the integration of non-timber forest product management and trading of environmental services.

Juruá REDD+ Project is located at Seringal Valparaíso property, in the Alto Juruá region, between the municipalities of Cruzeiro do Sul and Porto Walter, including an area of 24,076 hectares. Juruá River basin is formed by four micro-basins: the micro-basin of Igarapé do Meio, the micro-basin of Igarapé Primeiro de Março and the Igarapé Grande micro-basin, in addition to the Valparaiso river basin (micro-basin) itself, which is the main drainage network of the rubber plantation region.

The purpose of the project is to reduce GHG emissions from activities regarding to conserve the forest and its natural resources, as well as to maintain carbon stocks, through activities that promote the reduction of deforestation in the region, such as the improvement of patrimonial vigilance, the monitoring of land use change and land cover using satellite images and strengthening the management of non-timber forest products. The performance of activities allied to a good project management, with continuous monitoring and evaluation of activities and results, will allow the Project to reach the expected goals and effects.

Therefore, it is expected that Juruá REDD+ Project prevents, by curbing deforestation, about 3,431,971 tCO2e by reducing GHG emissions throughout 30 years of the project. All the proposed activities to curb deforestation will become economically feasible if the management of non-timber forest products is combined with the trading of carbon credits through REDD+ carbon crediting mechanisms.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES IN INDIA
description: The project aims at achieving sustainable management practices which reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by reducing the dependency on chemical fertilizers by replacing them with environment-friendly organic-based soil amendments, low or no tillage, and reduce/stop Biomass burning and Fossil fuel usage. title: Guiyang Afforestation Project
description:
Guiyang Afforestation Project (hereafter refer to as “the project”) is located at Guiyang City.
10,158.2 ha (152,373 Mu ) of forest was planted on suitable land for afforestation in Guiyang City where used to be poorly sustainable in terms of ecological environment and suffer from karst rocky desertification. Prior to the project, the project area was suitable land for forest, there is no forestry management and the coverage by planting trees is low, and there has never been any activity affecting the local ecosystem . By checking the afforestation plan with the Guiyang Forestry Bureau, it was confirmed that a small number of trees have been planted in the project area before the afforestation project. However, the forest coverage rate is relatively low. Therefore, considering this situation, the Guiyang Forestry Bureau determined that the project area is suitable for afforestation after investigation, then the Forestry Bureau approved the supplementary planting without disturbing the existing trees to increase the vegetative cover. The forest farm and Guiyang Forestry Industry Development Co., Ltd implement the afforestation project, and Guiyang Forestry Industry Development Co., Ltd is authorized to apply for carbon sink projects on behalf of the forest farm, and to implement management activities such as monitoring.
The project is to plant without disturbing the existing trees, and only the trees actually planted in the project were monitored. The carbon credit of the original trees in the baseline scenario will not be monitored or counted in the actual net GHG removals by sinks.
VCS Proponent:
Guiyang Forestry Industry Development Co., Ltd
Guizhou, China

Guiyang Forestry Industry Development Co., Ltd
Guizhou, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Lomphat Wildlife Sanctuary REDD+ Project
description:
The Lomphat Wildlife Sanctuary (LWS) belongs to Eastern Plain Landscape (EPL) was established in 1993 by the Cambodia royal government, covering an area 250,000 hectares within the provinces of Ratanakiri (accounting for approximately 80%) and Mondulkiri (20% of the area). Most of Lomphat land areas are dominated by dry deciduous forest and followed by semi-evergreen and evergreen forest, grassland, traditional crops, ponds, streams and Repos River that are reliable for thousands of endangered, vulnerable, and rare species. LWS has also been marked in recent years with significant impacts of human activities including: deforestation, mining, land conversion for agriculture, forest encroachment, new road construction, hunting and trapping, resettlement and increasing population. To ensure the effective protection of the EPL-LWS, conservation actions need to promote the significance of forests while helping to address and support sustainable livelihood development of the local population.
From 2010 to 2018, the loss of forest cover in LWS has increased by 16.4% or 41,659.30 hectares, resulting in the loss of biodiversity and greater pressures on endangered species. BirdLife International Program in Cambodia (BirdLife) in close collaboration with the Ministry of Environment (MoE) and NGO partners, has supported and lead conservation activities in the region with the focus on capacity development for law enforcement, forest monitoring, preservation of endangered species and facilitating local community participation. In 2018, the project expanded its strategic approach for LWS to incorporate carbon finance, specifically REDD+, which have been defined as the most appropriate mechanism for addressing financial sustainability, refining activities for natural resource management and providing key benefits for community development and livelihoods. This initiative is also contributes to the 3rd strategic direction of Cambodia's Climate Change Strategic Plan (CCCSP).
VCS Proponent:
Royal Government of Cambodia (RGC), Ministry of Environment

description: The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittently flooded conditions during rice cultivation is conducted in the east of Fangzheng County, Harbin City, Heilongjiang Province, China, with a total acreage of 17,644 ha of single-cropping rice. The original scenario in which rice was cultivated by the continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Due to the anaerobic decomposition of organic matter in the paddy soil under flooded conditions, a large amount of methane can be released, so the intermittently flooded method is more conducive to saving water, improving rice yield and reducing methane emissions than the continuously flooded method.
VCS Proponent:
Gansu Hongmao Agriculture Development Co.,Ltd
Gansu, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Zhaoyuan-1 Water Management with Rice Cultivation
description: The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation is conducted in the west of Zhaoyuan County, Daqing City, Heilongjiang Province, China, with a total acreage of 17,152 ha for single-cropping rice. The project area contains the project fields of rice merely, and the data of total area is confirmed by the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Bureau of Zhaoyuan County. The project is expected to reduce GHG emissions by replacing continuously flooded method with intermittent flooded method. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, this method can reduce the flooded time of rice in the whole growth cycle and the methane (CH4) emissions, and is more beneficial to production increase than the continuously flooded as well. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the backward continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario.
VCS Proponent:
Gansu Hongmao Agriculture Development Co.,Ltd
Gansu, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: ARR SLB Paraná
description: ARR SLB Paraná is an Afforestation and reforestation (AR )grouped project located in the Brazilian state of Paraná in the municipalities of Tomazina, Sapopema y Arapoti. Its main objective is to mitigate climate change through the carbon sequestration with eucalypt forest plantations. The project aims to promote the sustainable development of the forestry sector by providing fair job opportunities, recovering degraded soils from livestock and traditional and industrialized agriculture for soybean cultivation, and conserving natural forest areas within the project areas to enhance and protect the local biodiversity.
VCS Proponent:
SLB International S.A.S.
France
c.gosset@slbsa.com
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Teak Plantations at Engenho Brasileiro farm and Serra Novam
description: Forest plantations in Brazil make up around 1% of the country's area, and are responsible for 91% of all wood production for industrial purposes. There are 9.9 million hectares planted in total; 36% of these areas are destined for pulp and paper, and solid wood products represent 4% of the total or around 400,000 ha. Of these, teak plantations make up almost 94,000 ha in Brazil. Therefore, the objective of the project is to establish an investment case for a greenfield afforestation teak project in two farms in the Pernambuco region, established on below average quality agricultural lands generally used for sugarcane production and as pastureland. Development of the project for carbon credit generation will yield revenues earlier on in the project life than timber incomes normally would, and will support the financial case for making the investment.
VCS Proponent:
CHLA Compra e Venda de Imóveis S.A.
Pernambuco, Brazil
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Sustainable Agroforestry Cacao Meta, Colombia
description:
Located in the department of Meta, Cabuyaro is a municipality whose surface equals to 832 kilometers square, with a population of 5,432 inhabitants, and an altitude of 151 meters above the sea level (DANE, Censo Nacional de Poblacion y Vivienda, 2018). The project is located in Guayabal, a small town in Cabuyaro composed of 204 inhabitants who mainly work the land, growing a variety of crops such as plantain, cassava, papaya, passion fruit, corn, soy, and cacao which are mainly sold in the local market of Villavicencio.
This is a grouped project, the first area to be verified, consists of a total of 2,258 hectares composed of degraded pastures in majority and conservation areas, at the baseline. Of which 1,764 hectares will be established in an agroforestry system, with cacao being the perennial crop planted with other trees for shading purposes (Gliricidia sepium) and boundary purposes (windbreakers -Cariniana pyriformis). This agroforestry system has the goal of increase the soil organic carbon, as well as the aboveground and below ground biomass, and will recover the soil health and fertility through time. Other relevant agricultural practices that will be implemented are proper residue management as crop/tree materials that are periodically pruned are left in the soil for decomposition to build organic matter, processing of the cacao husks to produce organic fertilizer to be applied back in the field, as well as planting cover crops in bare soil areas, irrigation,  and planting boundary trees to prevent erosion and reduce wind damage to the cacao.
The rest of the project area, 491 hectares, corresponds to other uses such as drainage channels, internal roads, and conservation areas which included native forest species, called morichales, riparian zones, and secondary forests. The total project area is divided into two properties, Espejuelos (1,258 hectares) and Primavera (1,000 hectares).
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
CCB Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Harpia Grouped REDD+ Project
description:
The primary objective of the Harpia Grouped REDD+ Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD) of the Amazon rainforest and, as a grouped project, offers the possibility to expand the conservation to other areas in the future. The first instance is composed of 3 properties, with a project area of 18,700.24 ha, located in Cotriguaçu, State of Mato Grosso.

Besides the project’s ecological and carbon benefits, a proportion of the carbon credits generated will be dedicated to improving the social and environmental conditions in the project region, specifically contributing to improving deforestation control, and developing environmental education and other social activities. The contribution to sustainability is being monitored through the application of the SOCIALCARBON® Standard.

The present REDD project is expected to avoid a predicted 3,681 ha of deforestation, equating to 1,552,613 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime (09-December-2019 to 08-December-2049), with an annual average of 51,753 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent:
Future Carbon Holding S.A.
São Paulo, Brazil
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: ITABU REDD+ PROJECT IN ZAMBIA
description: This REDD+ project is an Avoided Unplanned Deforestation and Degradation activity. These forests are also directly critical to the lives and well-being of most of our people, including the communities. These areas are under stress due to logging, shifting agriculture, and other activities for decades. This initiative proceeds with promoting mitigation of climate change. The Project aims at Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation (REDD+) by avoiding unplanned deforestation under VERRA scheme. The project aims at the conservation of forests in the project area which is dominated by the Miombo woodlands. This REDD+ project initiative proceeds with promoting various activities to mitigate climate change and improving livelihoods of the local communities.

title: Jining-2 Water Management with Rice Cultivation
description:
The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittently flooded conditions during rice cultivation is conducted in the southern part of Jining City, Shandong Province, China, with a total acreage of 19,030 ha of single-cropping rice. Without the project, there would be no ditches, pumps, valves, and reservoirs to conduct the intermittently flooded method, the traditional continuously flooded method would be continued. The original scenario in which rice was cultivated by the continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Due to the anaerobic decomposition of organic matter in the paddy soil under flooded conditions, a large amount of methane can be released, so the intermittently flooded method is more conducive to saving water, improving rice yield and reducing methane emissions than the continuously flooded method.
The implementation activities of the project include cement ditch construction, reservoir construction, pumps and valves installation, training, etc. According to the needs of rice growth, farmers use pumps and valves to control irrigation and drainage, which not only saves water resources but also reduces methane emissions from soil organic matter under anaerobic conditions. Through the pumps and valves, the necessary water can be supplied to the rice paddies in time in the dry season, and the excess water can be drained from the rice paddies in the rainy season. In this case, the methane emission can be declined by an average of 48%. Hence, with the proposed project activity, the estimated GHG reduction from rice is 3.06 tCO2e/ha.
VCS Proponent:
Gansu Hongmao Agriculture Development Co.,Ltd
Gansu, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Methane avoidance in rice cultivation in South of Linxiang District
description:
Linxiang District is a county-level city in Hunan Province, is managed by Yueyang City. Linxiang located in the northeast of Hunan Province, is known as the Gateway to Northern Hunan, is one of the major rice producing districts in China, has a population about 541,864, and annual household income of farmers is only CNY 35,511. The project is located in South of Linxiang District, Yueyang City, Hunan Province, China, with a total acreage of 8,155.00 ha for double-cropping rice. The project activity is designed to construction the cement ditch and reservoir to realize the reducing of methane emissions by conducting intermittently flooded method instead of continuously flooded method during the cropping season in south of Linxiang City.
In the baseline scenario, farmers in Linxiang District use continuously flooded method in rice paddies with the straw on field as the organic amendment inputs, which means fields have standing water throughout the rice growing season and only dry out for harvest. However, the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane because of anaerobic decomposition. In the project scenario, farmers in Linxiang District changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation. By controlled the irrigation and drainage according to the needs of rice growth, can save water resources. On the other hand, multiple aeration during rice cultivation can effectively reduce methane emissions from soil organic matter under anaerobic conditions.
VCS Proponent:
Hunan Yueyang Huabanqiao Market Development Co., Ltd.
Hunan Province, China

title: ACABA REDD+ Project
description: The ACABA REDD+ Project is located in the General Community Council of the Baudó River and its Tributaries (ACABA) on the Pacific coast of the department of Chocó. The Project contains very humid tropical forest with transition to tropical pluvial forest, and has unique habitat conditions for both flora and fauna. It is considered an invaluable region at the national and international level and is classified as one of the of the most biodiverse hotspots on Earth, characterized by the presence of endemic species. Significant and exponential deforestation has occurred in the region over time, which according to the IDEAM forest monitoring report for the 2010-2017 period was 10,559 ha. This scenario is the caused by a lack of territorial planning, which in turn results in processes associated with wood extraction, the expansion of the agricultural frontier, the establishment of crops for illicit use, unplanned infrastructure, the construction of new road accesses, and itinerant open-pit mining. The project uses a standalone approach and an annual average of 208,556 tCO2e are expected to be reduced with a total reduction of 6,465,226 tCO2e over the project’s lifetime of thirty years. With the implementation of the REDD+ project, the community will achieve the reduction of emissions resulting from deforestation and forest degradation, and thereby environmental and social benefits will be generated. Additionally, economic resources will be available to be invested in the creation of productive opportunities aimed at improving the living conditions of the inhabitants, in alignment with the ACABA ethno-development plan. The Project is eligible under the VCS Program and uses the VM0009, v3 Methodology. The project will have a AUDD activity type baseline scenario, using Colombia’s national Forest Reference Emissions Levels (FREL). The project will generate GHG emission reductions by reducing unplanned deforestation, covering activities within the scope of the VCS Program.
VCS Proponent:

title: Amigos de Calakmul Community Conservation Forestry Project
description: The Amigos de Calakmul Community Forest Conservation Program (ACAC Program) is focused on protecting the forests and preventing land use change in the Calakmul Biosphere Reserve in Mexico. The program works with local communities called ejidos that reside in the reserve's buffer zone and area of influence. Instead of timber harvesting, participating ejidos receive conservation payments and social program support. Phase 1 of the program covers 10 ejidos and 95,077 hectares. The ejido members in the program area have limited livelihood options, and timber harvesting can be a significant economic activity, both legal and illegal. The Yucatan Peninsula has experienced significant forest and timber harvesting in the area leading to forest degradation, human access, and biodiversity loss. The program also focuses on diversifying income sources and improving livelihoods through productive projects, emphasizing community participation and input gathering. It was developed under the methodology VM0010 under VCS and will also be validated under the CCB.

title: Fuyuan-1 Water Management with Rice Cultivation
description: The project changing from continuously flooded to intermittent flooded condition during rice cultivation is conducted in Qianfeng Farms of northern Fuyuan City, Jiamusi City, Heilongjiang Province, China, with a total acreage of 18,255 ha for single-cropping rice. The project area contains the project fields of rice merely, and the data of total area is confirmed by the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Bureau of Fuyuan City. The project is expected to reduce GHG emissions by replacing continuously flooded method with intermittent flooded method. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded condition can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, this method can reduce the flooded time of rice in the whole growth cycle and the methane (CH4) emissions, and is more beneficial to production increase than the continuously flooded as well. Without the implementation of this project, which provides ditches to conduct intermittently flooded method, the backward continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario.
VCS Proponent:
Harbin Beigen Technology Co., Ltd.
Heilongjiang., China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: CORE CARBON VANAM(SERICULTURE) IN ODISHA STATE
description:
Core CarbonX Solutions Private Limited (CCX) is a carbon management consultancy company with registered office in the state of Odisha. CCX is the Project Proponent (PP) of the carbon offset project called “Core Carbon Vanam (Sericulture) in Odsha State”. CCX entered into carbon offset agreements with individual farmers of various districts of Odisha state for provision of carbon credit advisory services to them. The individual farmers are the owners of the lands on which trees are being grown to sequester carbon and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the atmosphere. CCX has mobilized the farmers in the selected states of India to plant various tree species on their lands. These tree species range from trees like Asana, Arjuna covering Sericulture sector. Simple tree cultivation techniques involving planting saplings in the pits with minimum disturbance to the lands have been employed by the selected farmers. 
The villages under the project area predominantly have an agrarian economy where most of its population depends on agriculture. The major agroforestry plantation in these project districts (Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj & Sundergarh) are Asana, Arjuna etc . The planation was done by the farmers and utilized the subsidies to avail the saplings. The saplings do the sequestration of carbon dioxide at faster pace and ultimately reduces GHG emissions. 
The Project Activity will lead to considerable carbon sequestration in the project areas and will contribute strongly to the sustainable development of rural villages involved in the project.
Initially, 6,300 hectares of land has been selected for the first project activity instance. Through carbon sequestration by the planted trees, the project is expected to generate annual average GHG emission reductions or removals of 62811 tCO2e.

title: EVI SUSTAINABLE AGRICULTURE PROGRAM
description:
The purpose of this grouped project (Program) is to replace the traditional practice of flooded irrigation (baseline) with System of Root Intensification (SRI) technique in rice cultivation (project). SRI is an intermittent wet and dry technique of cultivation which induces positive socio-economic and environmental impacts by reducing water consumption and increasing crop yield compared to baseline. This also results in reduced GHG emission emissions associated with energy use in water pumping and methane avoidance associated with standing water in farm fields compared to the baseline. Increase in yield and reduced water and energy consumption also yields socio-economic benefits to the farmers.  
The first project activity instance (VPA) under the program is located in the state of Odisha in India. In the baseline, farmers were using traditional agriculture practice of rice cultivation and replaced it with SRI in the project activity. The area covered in this VPA is up to 500 hectares. In the project activity, emission reductions happen due to methane avoidance from the farm fields and reduced electricity consumption. However, emission reductions due to methane avoidance alone, are being claimed under the program. It is estimated that 60,000 tCO2e of emission reductions will be generated per annum.
VCS Proponent:
Emergent Ventures India Private Limited
Singapore, Singapore
+91-124-4353100
atul@emergent-ventures.com
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: El Espinillar
description: The proposed project El Espinillar is located in the Northwestern part of Uruguay and covers nearly 2,956 hectares. The project region has a long history of sugar cane production for the beverage market in Uruguay.  Ancap Beberage and Alcohol Company (Compañía Ancap de Bebidas y Alcoholes S.A – CABA) was a Uruguayan company dedicated to the manufacturing and marketing of alcoholic beverage and liquors. The project region El Espinillar supplied the value chain with irrigated sugar cane production on Government-owned lands. In the early 90s, due to national economic reforms, the land was sold to several private owners with the aim of diversifying and boosting regional productivity. After that, coarse crop (e.g. maize) production with furrow irrigation and livestock farming activities were the main activities in the region. However, these activities were done under unsustainable practices leading to soil degradation. Following the aim to restore the soil, sequester carbon from the atmosphere and increase the yields per hectare, the project was established in 2019, with the focus on planting trees that produce high-value crops such as citrus fruits (lemon, mandarins, oranges, persimmon caqui), avocados, nuts (pecan, macadamia, almonds), and essential oil crops (e.g. eucalyptus). Through the photosynthesis of the newly planted trees, the project generates GHG emission removals up to 4,400 tons annually, while delivering ecological and socio-economic benefits at the same time. To ensure the success of the project activity, the project proponent seeks to establish irrigation systems, implement conservative measures to recover the degraded soil and achieve climate-neutral production. The project area also counts with a small extension of native riparian forest which will remain protected. The project will deliver economic, social, and ecological benefits to the local communities while making a significant contribution to the battle against climate change on a global scale.
VCS Proponent:
Kattegat S.R.L.
Montevideo, Uruguay
+598 2 604 70 50
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: REDD Project - Territorio Indígena Originario Campesino
description: This REDD+ project is an Avoided Unplanned Deforestation and Degradation activity. These forests are also directly critical to the lives and well-being of most of our people, including the communities. These areas are under stress due to logging, shifting agriculture, and other activities for decades. This initiative proceeds with promoting mitigation of climate change. The Project aims at Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation (REDD+) by avoiding unplanned deforestation under VERRA scheme. The project aims at the conservation of forests in the project area which is part of the Amazon basin, and it embraces a large portion of the lowland forest, with most of its area covered by semi-deciduous forest. This REDD+ project initiative proceeds with promoting various activities to mitigate climate change and improving livelihoods of the local communities.

title: 7.81MW solar power project by AMPSolar Generation Private Limited
description: The project involves installation of Solar Photovoltaic (SPV) Panels on rooftops and ground mounted in the premises of Hyderabad Metro Project by AMPSolar Generation Private Limited .All the rooftop and ground mounted solar panel units involved in the proj ect are implemented under DBFOT model , i.e., Design, Build, Finance, Operate and Transfer. The owners of the metro project are the customers of the power generated from the rooftop and ground mounted solarpanels who purchase the power from AMPSolar Generation Private Limited under long term power purchase agreements . The purchased power by the customers is used for captive purpose and consumed/utilized by the customers in the metro stations and depots Before installation of the rooftop solar units, the Hyderabad Metro premises used to meet the electricity demand from the national grid of the India. title: Core Carbon Sahaja Vyavasayam in Andhra Pradesh
description:
Andhra Pradesh has been historically called the Rice Bowl of India and continues to be the country's largest rice producer. The agriculture system forms the backbone of economic development and contributes 32.79 % of the total State Domestic Product.
The proposed Natural Farming in Andhra Pradesh activity is practised by individual farmers practised by about 5,00,000 farmers and organic grower cooperatives covering 6,41,230 hectares of cropland in the state of Andhra Pradesh to be implemented in the first phase. The project aims at increasing the capacity of soil to sequester carbon, enhance the carbon sequestration by agroforestry practices such as planting of trees, reduce emissions from the use of synthetic fertilizers and reduce emissions from burning of crop residue by application of VCS methodology: VM0017 Sustainable Agricultural Land Management (SALM). Several SALM practices and technologies have been proven to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and prevent climate change by enhancing carbon storage in soils, preserving existing soil carbon, and reducing carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous oxide emissions. Those practices include conservation tillage, cover crops, enhanced crop rotations, residue retention, agroforestry and avoidance of crop residue burning. The project holistically aims at achieving sustainable management practices which improve soil health, reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and develop the socio-economic status of the project area. The project aims to reduce and sequester carbon leading to estimated GHG emission reductions or removals (tCO2e) of 4830706 tCO2e / year. This project's climate benefits include emissions reduction or removals of approximately 193228248 tCO2e over the lifetime of the project.
VCS Proponent:
Core CarbonX Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
Andhra Pradesh, India
00919908387772
nmohanty@corecarbonx.com
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use
VCS Project Validator: TUV SUD South Asia Private Limited

title: Gansu Xiaolongshan Afforestation Project
description:
Gansu Xiaolongshan Afforestation Project (hereinafter referred to as “the project”) is located in the suburbs of Hui County, Liangdang County, Li County of Longnan City, suburbs of Qinzhou District, Maiji District, Qingshui County, Wushan County of Tianshui City, suburbs of Min County, Zhang County of Dingxi City, Gansu Province of China, whose aim is to increase carbon sequestration and contribute to local sustainable development by planting trees on the barren or degraded lands. The project is implemented by Gansu Xiaolongshan Forestry Conservation Center. 
3,738.23 ha (56073.4 Mu) of forest is to be planted by direct planting on barren lands in Tianshui City, Longnan City and Dingxi City, including seven suburbs and two counties: Qinzhou District, Maiji District, Qingshui County, Wushan County, Hui County, Liangdang County, Li County, Min County and Zhang County. All the project sites were previously barren lands. There is no natural renewal and afforestation before the project.
The implementation of the project would generate GHG emission removals and improve local environment through growing of the trees, increase income of local residents by offering job opportunities from the project, enhance the capabilities of local communities and residents by providing their relevant technical skills and training, and increase local biodiversity as a result of establishing a forest of native trees (Styphnolobium japonicum, Robinia pseudoacacia, Pinus, Picea)
The project is estimated to generate GHG emission removals of 2,721,683 tCO2e in 60 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 45,361 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
CCB Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: 50 MW (AC) SOLAR PARK AT SUTIAKHALI, GOURIPUR, MYMENSINGH
description: 50 MW (AC) SOLAR PARK AT SUTIAKHALI, GOURIPUR, MYMENSINGH is to utilize the renewable solar energy for electricity generation through the construction of a solar photovoltaic (PV) power plant. The proposed project is located a 170-acre plot of land approximately 7km South East from the town centre of Mymensingh City, Bangladesh. The electricity generated from the project will be supplied to Bangladesh National Power Grid, which is owned and operated by Power Grid Company of Bangladesh Ltd. (PGCB). The proposed project will achieve the greenhouse gas (GHG) emission reductions through the displacement of electricity delivered by Bangladesh National Power Grid which is a fossil-fuel dominated grid. The proposed project is invested and developed by HDFC SinPower Limited. The estimated annual average net electricity generation supplied to the grid is 92,192 MWh and the annual full-load operation time amount to 1,844 h per year during the operation period. The estimated emission reduction is 55,302 tCO2e annually.

HDFC Sinpower Limited
Dhaka, Bangladesh

Changshou District is located in the centre part of Chongqing, with a total acreage of 15,727 ha for single-cropping rice. Without implementing this project, which provides ditches to conduct the intermittently flooded method, the backward continuously flooded method would be continued, so the scenario that rice was cultivated by the continuously flooded method is the baseline scenario. Since the organic matter in rice soil under flooded conditions can emit a large amount of methane (CH4) because of anaerobic decomposition, the intermittently flooded method is more beneficial to water conservation, production increase and methane emission removal than the continuously flooded.The implementation of the project is expected to reduce the GHG emissions amounting to 865,564 tCO2e in 21 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 41,217.3 tCO2e.

title: Community Based Forest Plantation in India
description: “Community Forest Plantation in India” is a combined Afforestation and sustainable development project carried out by farmers with the help of a project implementer. The associated project implementer is helping farmers to plant trees on the land which is identified as unproductive, and the area is highly water scarce. Farmers retain ownership of the trees, products, and land as well. Farmers received training from the project implementer for plantation and the project implementer (Greenovation) is providing plantation material (saplings, manure) to the farmers and further assistance in maintaining the required survival rate of the plantation. Carbon credits generated from this project will help in maintaining the survival rate of planted trees and support farmers. The total area expected to be covered in the project is around 10,000 hectares. The current plantations have been covered to plant 4,400 hectares in the country.The project participants are using the afforestation approach and planted thousands of trees on the land across the project boundary. In case of the absence of this project activity land would be continued to be less productive land or degraded land. The project will help in mitigating climate change for the next 40 years by sequestrating/removing the carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and creating a carbon pool. The project activity will result in an annual average of 1,40,882 tons of GHG removal and total removal of 56,35,266 tons of CO2 over the 40 years of the period.
VCS Proponent:
Greenovation Sustainability Solutions Private Limited
Uttarakhand, India
CCB Proponent:
Greenovation Sustainability Solutions Private Limited
Uttarakhand, India
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Community Forestry Initiatives in India
description:
“Community Forest Initiative in India” is an sustainable afforestation development project carried out by the local farmers with the help of a local NGO. The farmers plant trees on the abandoned wasteland allotted to the communities and retain ownership of the trees, produce, from forestation. Project activity has been planned for helping farmers in developing forest for which they have received plantation material, Irrigation technology and other training received from NGO to establish and maintain the planted forest. NGO empowers the large group of poor communities in West Bengal and Odisha states of India to create & manage the forest on degraded abandoned land to increase forest cover by planting fruit-bearing species. Apart from above, the NGOs helps in managing and sustainably harvesting the NTFPs (Non-Timber Forest Products) for participating farmers. 
The carbon credits from this project activity will also create a new ‘virtual’ cash crop for the participants, who gain all the direct benefits of growing trees and receive benefits based on the GHG benefits created by their efforts (as a result-based payment approach). The maturing trees and conservation activity will provide additional sustainable benefits such as income in form of the carbon payments, climate change mitigation self-resilience and sustainable. . The project will help in mitigating climate change for the next 40 years by sequestrating the carbon from the atmosphere and creating a natural biomass carbon pool. NGO has estimated that this project will result in an annual average of GHG removal of 1,45,278 tonnes/annual and total removals of 58,11,102 tonnes of CO2 for 40 years of project duration.
VCS Proponent:
SAUNTA GAUNTA FOUNDATION
Odisha, India
CCB Proponent:
SAUNTA GAUNTA FOUNDATION
Odisha, India
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: COMMUNITY PARTICIPATIVE FORESTRY/AGROFORESTRY DEVELOPMENT PROJECT IN INDIA
description: Grouped Reforestation Project on Degraded Land and Fallow Agricultural Land is located within the borders of India. The project aims to establish forests across India on degraded land and unused land not currently used for forestation. The first project activity instance (VPA) under the program is located in the state of Uttar Pradesh (Pratapgarh, Amethi, Sultanpur, Raebareli, Unnao, Prayagraj), Madhya Pradesh (Sagar, Tikamgarh) and Rajasthan (Rajsamand, Chittorgarh) in India Indian Farm Forestry Development Co-operative Limited (has implemented the VPA from 0 1 Jul 2015 covering an area of about 600 hectares. This project provides an opportunity for the rural poor to restore degraded lands and improve their living conditions. The project has assisted farmers, especially women, to promote plantation on wastelands and marginally productive lands by organizing primary farm forestry co-operatives and thus making it a people's participative programme. The project activities will help in improving soil and water conservation and bringing about ecological balance, and generating consistent employment for the rural poor and thus help them in their socio-economic development.
VCS Proponent:
Indian Farm Forestry Development Co-operative Ltd.
Gurgaon Haryana, India
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Core Farming in Odisha
description: The proposed ‘Core Farming in Odisha’ implemented by about 76,000 farmers and organic grower cooperatives overing 98,000 hectares of cropland in the state of Odisha to be implemented in the first phase. The project aims at increasing the capacity of soil to sequester carbon, enhance the carbon sequestration by natural farming, agroforestry practices such as planting of trees, reduce emissions from use of synthetic fertilizers and reduce emissions from burning of crop residue by application of VCS methodology: VM0017 Sustainable Agricultural Land Management (SALM). Several SALM practices and technologies have been proven to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and prevent climate change by enhancing carbon storage in soils; preserving existing soil carbon; and reducing carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous oxide emissions. Some of those practices are conservation tillage, cover crops, enhanced crop rotations, residue retention, agroforestry and avoidance of crop residue burning. The project holistically aims at achieving sustainable management practices which improves soil health, reduces greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and develop the socio-economic status of the project area. The project aims to reduce and sequester carbon leading to an estimated GHG emission reductions or removals (tCO2e) of 774200 tCO2e / year. This projects climate benefits include emissions reduction or removals of approximately 30968000 (thirty million ninety-six hundred eight thousand) tCO2e over the lifetime of the project.
VCS Proponent:
Core CarbonX Solutions Pvt. Ltd.

title: Improving livelihoods through Agroforestry Plantations in India
description: This project aims for the sustainable implementation and management of Afforestation activity that involves carbon sequestration on degraded lands through agroforestry plantation activities with species plantations in the multiple districts of India. The project includes multiple land parcels (continue and scattered). The project has been undertaken to plant agroforestry species on the land which was severly degraded in the baseline and continues to be degraded. Before the project activity, the project area was facing threat due to severe soil erosion from slash and burn rotations. The project tends to combat land degradation and emphasize the role of project in the UN sustainable development and land restoration agenda. The project activity is expected to reduce atmospheric CO2 by sequestration and storing in the form of biomass. The project is expected to be functional and remove CO2 from the atmosphere for 80 years of its lifetime with 30 years of renewable period. The Project activities are carried out and monitored according to the approved project methodology AR-ACM0003 for the first crediting period of 30 years. The project aims to remove an estimated 39,445 tCO2e annually and 11,83,343 tCO2e during the first crediting period.
VCS Proponent:

China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: REDD+ Project for the Conservation of Lowland Forest in the  Magdalena Medio Region of Colombia
description:
The Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation (REDD+) Project for the Conservation of Lowland Forest in the Magdalena Medio region of Columbia is an initiative led by Fundación Biodiversa Colombia (FBC) and Fundación Proyecto Primates, supported by Interconexión Eléctrica S.A. E.S.P. (ISA) and South Pole within the Jaguar Connection Program (PCJ). The purpose of this initiative is the certification of actions for the reduction of carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions against the unplanned deforestation and forest degradation of approximately 8,000 hectares (ha) of forest. The area where REDD+ project activities are being carried out is located in the municipalities of Yondó and Puerto Berrío, in the department of Antioquia, and the municipalities of Cimitarra and Puerto Parra, in the department of Santander (Colombia). Currently, the land use scenarios include the expansion of the cattle frontier, subsistence agriculture and
illegal logging of timber species. These scenarios are present, without exception, in all the properties that comprise the project. As mentioned above, this initiative hopes to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by avoiding unplanned deforestation of the forest remnants in the project area, which are well known for being the best-preserved forests in the Magdalena Medio region, and for the wide diversity of flora and fauna species that inhabit them.
VCS Proponent:
Fundación Biodiversa Colombia (FBC)
DC, Colombia

VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: CORE CARBON SERICULTURE PLANTATION IN ODISHA STATE
description:
The villages under the project area predominantly have an agrarian economy where most of its population depends on agriculture. The major agroforestry plantation in these project districts (Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj & Sundergarh) are Asana, Arjuna, Cashew and Mango. The plantation was done by the farmers and utilized subsidies to avail the saplings. The saplings do sequestration of carbon dioxide at a faster pace and ultimately reduce GHG emissions.  Initially, 10,520 hectares of land have been selected for the first project activity instance. Through carbon sequestration by the planted trees, the project is expected to generate annual average GHG emission reductions or removals of 104,844 tCO2e.
The selected farmers are those farmers who did not plant anything on their lands as they were fallow lands. CCX company held workshops in the villages and advised the villagers to grow Asana & Arjuna, Cashew and Mango trees in a sustainable manner to earn carbon revenue. The idea of earning additional revenue caught the farmer’s attention, and they decided to enter into carbon-offset agreements with the CCX company.

Core CarbonX Solutions Pvt. Ltd.

title: Kokolopori Bonobo Peace Forest Grouped REDD Project
description:
The primary objective of the Kokolopori Bonobo Peace Forest Grouped REDD Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD) in the rainforest of the Congo Basin. This is a grouped project and the 1st instance has an area of around 421,000 ha. 

The present REDD Project is expected to avoid a predicted 47,780 ha, equating to 31,416,402 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime (26-February-2021 to 25-February-2051).

title: Ban Odisha 01
description:
Core CarbonX Solutions Private Limited (CCX) is a carbon management consultancy company with registered office in the state of Telangana. CCX is the Project Proponent (PP) of the carbon offset project called “Ban Odisha01” in all districts of Odisha. The Project Activity will lead to considerable carbon sequestration in the project areas and will contribute strongly to the sustainable development of rural villages involved in the project.
The project quantifies the GHG removals occurring from agroforestry plantations through the use of AR-ACM0003: “Afforestation and reforestation project activities implemented on lands other than wetlands”, Version 02.0 developed under the Clean Development Mechanism for large-scale plantations. The project plans to generate carbon credits for the voluntary market under the VCS standard. Such planting activity would result in carbon credits that would be sold in the carbon market to generate revenue. As per the Carbon-offset agreement entered into between the farmers and CCX, 60%-80 of the carbon income generated from the sale of carbon credits would be distributed among the farmers. The project activity was implemented in 1900 hectares. Through carbon sequestration by the planted trees, the project is expected to generate annual average GHG emission reductions or removals of 15671 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent:
Core CarbonX Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
Andhra Pradesh, India

VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: THAMMA RAKSA - REFORESTATION AND LAND RESTORATION IN THAILAND
description:
The project “THAMMA RAKSA” was started in 2016 with the objective to support landowners in Isaan Region, in Thailand to restoring biodiversity on degraded land and agroforestry model on rice land to alleviate poverty, improve of farmers’ resilience with income diversification,

PUR Projet develops agroforestry and land rehabilitation projects with implementing partners (agricultural cooperatives & organizations) and smallholder farmers who want to engage into more virtuous agricultural practices. The implementing partners in charge of providing technical support, training, and free access to seedlings - PUR Projet will work with participants to plant trees on their land in the interest of protection and restoration. 
The main objectives of the project are as follows:
●	Increase climate change resilience of agricultural lands, diversify incomes, and restore ecosystem services by supporting agroforestry practices.
●	Implement full stand rehabilitation and restoration of degraded lands.
●	Climate change mitigation through carbon removals generated by tree-planting activities.
●	Raise environmental awareness and knowledge within rural communities and promote sustainable agriculture practices.

This project consists of tree planting rolled-out over annual planting waves. The project has planted 505,251 trees from 2016 to 2020. in five provinces of Thailand, namely: Yasothon, Surin, Sisaket, Buriram, and Ubon Ratchatani. All these provinces are located in the Isan Region (also known as “Northeast Region) However, the project is expected to grow over the time under the modality of a grouped project with regular inclusion of new instances. Geographical extension of the grouped project could include plantations in any province of Thailand.
VCS Proponent:
The PURE PROJECT SAS
Paris, France
+56 983 58 42 75
carbon@purprojet.com
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

The project quantifies the GHG removals occurring from agroforestry plantations through the use of AR-ACM0003 “: Afforestation and reforestation project activities implemented on lands other than wetlands”, Version 02.0 developed under the Clean Development Mechanism for large-scale plantations. The project plans to generate carbon credits for the voluntary market under the VCS standard. Such planting activity would result in carbon credits that would be sold in the carbon market to generate revenue. As per the Carbon-offset agreement entered into between the farmers and CCX, 60%-80% of the carbon income generated from the sale of carbon credits would be distributed among the farmers. The project activity was implemented in 1900 hectares. Through carbon sequestration by the planted trees, the project is expected to generate annual average GHG emission reductions or removals of 15671 tCO2e.

title: KOPI LESTARI AGROFORESTRY AND LAND REHABILITATION WITH SMALLHOLDER FARMERS IN INDONESIA
description:
Kopi lestari Agroforestry and land rehabilitation with smallholder farmers in Indonesia is a grouped afforestation and reforestation project initiated by PUR Projet in 2016. The purpose of the project is to reforest the degraded land and to promote sustainable agroforestry with smallholder farmers located in Aceh, North Sumatra and Lampung Provinces in Sumatra Region, Indonesia.

, PUR Projet develops agroforestry and land rehabilitation projects with implementing partners (agricultural cooperatives & organizations) and smallholder farmers who want to engage into more virtuous agricultural practices. Providing technical support, training, and free access to seedlings - PUR Projet will work with participants to plant trees on their land in the interest of protection and restoration. This project consists of tree planting rolled-out over annual planting waves. The project has planted approximately 808,788 trees from 2016 to 2020. 
The main objectives of the project are as follows:
•	Increase climate change resilience of agricultural lands, diversify incomes, and restore ecosystem services by supporting agroforestry practices.
•	Implement full stand rehabilitation and restoration of degraded lands.
•	Climate change mitigation through carbon removals generated by tree-planting activities.
•	Raise environmental awareness and knowledge within rural communities and promote sustainable agriculture practices.
VCS Proponent:
The PURE PROJECT SAS
Paris, France
+56 983 58 42 75
carbon@purprojet.com
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Agro Forestry01
description: Horae Energy (Pvt) Ltd is the Project Proponent (PP) of the carbon offset project called “Agro Forestry01” in Attock, Islamabad, Chakwal, Sargodha, Khusab, Mianwali, Bhakkar. Faisalabad, Toba Tek Singh, Jhang, M.B.Din, Gujranwala, Hafizabad, Nankana Sahib, Sahiwal, Pakpattan, Multan, Lodhran, Khanewal, Vehari, Muzzafar Garh, Layyah, D.G.Khan and Rajanpur districts of Punjab. The carbon credit rights are transferred to Horae Energy (Pvt) Ltd, which in turn will share the carbon revenue with farmers on the realisation of carbon credits. The individual farmers are the owners of the lands on which trees are being grown to sequester carbon and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the atmosphere. Horae Energy (Pvt) Ltd has mobilized the farmers in the selected states of Punjab to plant various tree species on their lands. These tree species range from fruit-bearing trees like Guava, Mango, and lemon to commercial species like Olive, Shisha, etc. The selected farmers have employed simple tree cultivation techniques involving planting saplings in the pits with minimum disturbance to the lands. Core CarbonX Solutions Private Limited (CCX) is a carbon management consultancy company that manages the carbon management cycle of the project. The project quantifies the GHG removals occurring from agroforestry plantations through the use of AR-ACM0003: “Afforestation and reforestation project activities implemented on lands other than wetlands”, Version 02.0 developed under the Clean Development Mechanism for large-scale plantations. The project plans to generate carbon credits for the voluntary market under the VCS standard. The project activity was implemented in 125824 hectares. Through carbon sequestration by the planted trees, the project is expected to generate annual average GHG emission reductions or removals of 1699482 tCO2e.

title: Tshopo Lomami Grouped REDD Project
description:
The primary objective of the Tshopo Lomami Grouped REDD Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD) in the rainforest of the Congo Basin. It’s a project composed by 3 instances with a total project area of 733,325.53ha. 

The present REDD Project is expected to avoid a predicted 145,520.18 ha, equating to 63,603,129 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime (20-September-2020 to 19-September-2050) with an annual average of 2,120,104 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
