title: Canindé Grouped REDD+ Project
description:
The main objective of the Canindé REDD+ Project is to avoid unplanned deforestation (AUD) within a project area of 4,458.86 ha and to avoid planned deforestation (APD) within a project area of 843 ha, both consisting of 100% of Amazon rainforest. The project area is located on 3 private properties, located in the municipality of Colniza, in the State of Mato Grosso. This project was conceived as a grouped project, in order to be able to increase its contribution to the standing forest with the addition of new instances of project activity in the future.

The AUD REDD project is expected to avoid predicted deforestation of 4,458.86 ha, which is equivalent to 1,521,031 tCO2e in emission reductions over the 30-year life of the project (from 10/October/2022 to 09/October/2052), with an annual average of 50,701 tCO2e.

The APD REDD project is expected to avoid predicted deforestation of 843 ha, which is equivalent to 163,451 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30 years of the project, with an annual average of 5,448 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent: Multiple Proponents
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Shanxi Jingle Afforestation Project
description:
Shanxi Jingle Afforestation Project (hereafter as “the project”) locates in Jingle County, Xinzhou City, Shanxi Province of North China. The aim of the project is to increase carbon sequestration and contribute to local sustainable development by planting trees on the barren mountains. The project was implemented by the project proponent Jingle County Sailing Carbon Sink Development Co. Ltd.
40151.69 ha of forest is to be planted by direct planting on barren lands in Jingle County, which has jurisdiction over 6 towns: Echeng Town, Dujiacun Town, Kangjiahui Town, Fengrun Town, Shuanglu Town, Wangcun Town; 6 townships: Duanjiazhai Township, Xinxiang Township, Shenyugou Township, Niangzishen Township, Suopo Township, Chiniwa Township; and 223 administrative villages. All the project sites were previously barren lands. There is no natural renewal and afforestation before the project. 
The planted trees are native species of Pinus tabuliformis, Larix gmelinii and Prunus dacidiana. The implementation of the afforestation project will generate GHG emission removals and mitigate climate change; improve soil and water conservation and forest cover; enhance local biodiversity by increasing the connectivity of forests and bring income and job opportunities for local communities and residents.
The project is expected to generate GHG emission removals of 14,926,485 tCO2e in 60 years, with an average annual GHG emission removal of 248,774.75 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent:
Jingle County Sailing Carbon Sink Development Co. LTD
Shanxi Province, China
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Arataú REDD Project
description:
The primary objective of the Arataú REDD Project is to avoid the unplanned deforestation (AUD) within the 25,417.85 ha project area, consisting of 100% Amazon rainforest. The project area is a private property, which is located in three different municipalities in the State of Pará: Tucuruí, Pacajá and Novo Repartimento. This project was designed as a grouped project, as to be able to increase its contribution to the standing forest with the addition of new project activity instances in the future.

In addition to the project’s ecological and carbon benefits, a proportion of the carbon credits generated will be dedicated to improving the social and environmental conditions in the project region, specifically contributing to improving deforestation control, aiming at the propagation of environmental awareness, generation of alternative sources of income and environmental education actions.

The present REDD project is expected to avoid a predicted 11,105 ha of deforestation, equating to 5,414,313 tCO2e in emissions reductions over the 30-year project lifetime, with an annual average of 180,478 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent:
Future Carbon Holding S.A.
São Paulo, Brazil
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Uirapuru Grouped REDD Project
description:
The Rio Branco Grouped REDD Project is located in the state of Acre, Brazil, initially formed by 2 properties composed of 100% of the Amazon Forest. The project aims to avoid unplanned deforestation (AUD) in an area of 8,318 ha and to avoid planned deforestation (APD) in an area of 464 ha. 

In addition to the ecological and carbon benefits of the project, a proportion of the carbon credits generated will be dedicated to improving socio-environmental conditions in the project region, specifically contributing to improving deforestation control and developing environmental education and other social activities.
VCS Proponent:
Future Carbon Holding S.A.
São Paulo, Brazil
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: Goldbeck Forest Carbon Project
description: Aurum Sustainable Forest Inc (Aurum) is developing a forest carbon credit project to generate greenhouse gas (GHG) emission reductions and removals by extending the rotation age of their operational forests. In addition to increasing the age of their forestlands, the Goldbeck Forest Carbon Project (Goldbeck) will be reverting stand compositions back to natural longleaf pine forests where appropriate. Project instances will be implemented in the states of Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina, Texas and Virginia; of the United States. The project has been designed as a grouped project to allow for additional project activity instances to be added in the future. All activity instances included in the project are currently managed for timber harvest, and all forests within the project activity instances are Forest Stewardship Council® (FSC®) certified.
VCS Proponent:
Aurum Sustainable Forest Inc.
Georgia, United States
VCS Project Type: Agriculture Forestry and Other Land Use

title: FUJIAN PUCHENG IMPROVED FOREST MANAGEMENT PROJECT
description:
The Fujian Pucheng Improved Forest Management Project (hereafter “the project activity”) is
implemented in Pucheng County, Nanping City, Fujian Province of China by Zhejiang
Zhongzheng Forestry Development Co., Ltd, the geo-coordinate of the project proponent is
118°11’ ~118°49’ E and 27°32’ ~28°22’ N, the total area is 9,418.16 ha, which includes the
Improved Forest Management (IFM) of the forests in the conversion of logged to protected
forest.
The area of the project activity is 9,418.16 ha, including 1,919 subcompartments spreading
over Fuling county, Gulou county, Guancuo county, Haocun county, Jiumu county, Liantang
county, Linjiang county, Panting county, Shanxia county, Shipo county, Shuibei Street county,
Wanan county, Xianyang county, Yongxing county, Zhongxin county, all these counties have the
legal right to forest ownership. The species involved in the project are Masson Pine, Chinese Fir
and Hard Broad-Leaved tree.
Prior the implementation of the project activity, the trees are logged based on a valid and
verifiable government-approved timber management plan for harvesting the project area. The
implementation of the project activity converses the trees to protected forest to reduce the GHG
emissions for about 2,518,926 tCO2e in 30 years, the average annual emission reduction is
83,964 tCO2e and Verified Carbon Units with buffer deduction is about 1,964,762 tCO2e in 30
years, the average annual VCUs with buffer deduction is 65,492 tCO2e.
VCS Proponent:
Zhejiang Zhongzheng Forestry Development Co.,Ltd
Zhejiang, China
